commit_message:
Add i18n translation to others 1/3

This is 1 of 3 commits that adds i18n translation to misc files.

Custom hacking rules will be added later to enforce this style.

commit_message:
Update README.RST

As the sake of the introduce of Django 1.8.16 [1], A devstack patch [2]
was sent in order to make gate and development environment deployment
easier, by setting:
    `ALLOWED_HOSTS = ['*']`.
So, the devolopment flow of dashboard can reference it.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.10/releases/1.8.16/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/400825/

Change-Id: I825da415fe21d0e9ef8617507525446d8e91b1ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor-dashboard refs/changes/73/413873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Open up the ``openstack_dashboard/settings.py`` file in your preferred text editor. You will want to customize several settings: - Verify or Add ``ALLOWED_HOSTS`` like "ALLOWED_HOSTS = ['*']", it should be configured with the hostname of your OpenStack server. - Verify or Add ``DEBUG`` like "DEBUG = True".

commit_message:
Enable Angular Launch Instance by default

This patch enables the Angular Launch Instance workflow by default. The
toggle has been maintained for those running the Python workflow, and
also for the integration tests to run against both simultaneously.

Keep integration tests running for a legacy Launch Instance workflow
by means of a separate local_settings.d code snippet activated before
starting the tests.

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Id0c57b33df46397711e32092cec6cc5268841779
Implements: blueprint enable-angular-launch-instance
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/287710/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Launch Instance has been moved to an improved workflow written with # AngularJS and the Python version is deprecated. This toggle will be # removed in a future release. LAUNCH_INSTANCE_LEGACY_ENABLED = False LAUNCH_INSTANCE_NG_ENABLED = True

commit_message:
Add test_volume_snapshots_pagination()

2 tests are added: for regular and admin users.
test_volume_snapshots.py has been modified to reduce duplicated code;
volumesPage.create_volume_snapshot() return volumesnapshotspage to
reflect automation navigation from Volumes to Snapshots;
Modification in tables.py allows to use prev/next locators for
all tables.

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: I7777e46c28117d472e9cbd17e2d95f45c358fc43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/43/281443/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def create_volume_snapshot(self, row, snapshot_name, description='test'): snapshot_form.name.text = snapshot_name

commit_message:
Added test for check QoS Spec creation and deletion functionality

Test checks that create/delete QoS Specs actions are executed without
errors under admin user.
Volume Types page object was defined similar to other pages.

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: I33bbabac3e44b97ec586adfa2c5780bbfbb07787
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/61/267361/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from selenium.common import exceptions from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.pages import basepage from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.regions import forms from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.regions import tables class QosSpecsTable(tables.TableRegion): name = 'qos_specs' CREATE_QOS_SPEC_FORM_FIELDS = ("name", "consumer") @tables.bind_table_action('create') def create_qos_spec(self, create_button): create_button.click() return forms.FormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, None, self.CREATE_QOS_SPEC_FORM_FIELDS) @tables.bind_table_action('delete') def delete_qos_specs(self, delete_button): delete_button.click() return forms.BaseFormRegion(self.driver, self.conf) class VolumetypesPage(basepage.BaseNavigationPage): QOS_SPECS_TABLE_NAME_COLUMN = 'name' CINDER_CONSUMER = 'back-end' def __init__(self, driver, conf): super(VolumetypesPage, self).__init__(driver, conf) self._page_title = "Volumes" @property def qos_specs_table(self): return QosSpecsTable(self.driver, self.conf) def _get_row_with_qos_spec_name(self, name): return self.qos_specs_table.get_row( self.QOS_SPECS_TABLE_NAME_COLUMN, name) def create_qos_spec(self, qos_spec_name, consumer=CINDER_CONSUMER): create_qos_spec_form = self.qos_specs_table.create_qos_spec() create_qos_spec_form.name.text = qos_spec_name create_qos_spec_form.submit() def delete_qos_specs(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_qos_spec_name(name) row.mark() confirm_delete_qos_spec_form = self.qos_specs_table.delete_qos_specs() confirm_delete_qos_spec_form.submit() def is_qos_spec_present(self, name): return bool(self._get_row_with_qos_spec_name(name)) def is_qos_spec_deleted(self, name): try: getter = lambda: self._get_row_with_qos_spec_name(name) self.wait_till_element_disappears(getter) except exceptions.TimeoutException: return False return True

commit_message:
Pagination for flavor - prev link

More link for flavors table is already supported, this patch adds
support to prev link for flavors table.

Implement blueprint: pagination-for-flavor

Change-Id: I3111e929c59077a0e52bf8f84a512ee18eee5f12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/28/288228/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_pagination(entities, page_size, marker, sort_dir, sort_key, reversed_order): has_more_data, has_prev_data = False, False if len(entities) > page_size: has_more_data = True entities.pop() if marker is not None: has_prev_data = True # first page condition when reached via prev back elif reversed_order and marker is not None: has_more_data = True # last page condition elif marker is not None: has_prev_data = True # restore the original ordering here if reversed_order: entities = sorted(entities, key=lambda entity: (getattr(entity, sort_key) or '').lower(), reverse=(sort_dir == 'asc')) return entities, has_more_data, has_prev_data paginate=False, sort_key="id", sort_dir="desc", reversed_order=False): has_prev_data = False if reversed_order: sort_dir = 'desc' if sort_dir == 'asc' else 'asc' limit=page_size + 1, sort_key=sort_key, sort_dir=sort_dir) flavors, has_more_data, has_prev_data = update_pagination( flavors, page_size, marker, sort_dir, sort_key, reversed_order) return (flavors, has_more_data, has_prev_data)
deleted_lines: def update_pagination(entities, page_size, marker): has_more_data = False if len(entities) > page_size: has_more_data = True entities.pop() return entities, has_more_data paginate=False): limit=page_size + 1) flavors, has_more_data = update_pagination(flavors, page_size, marker) return (flavors, has_more_data)

'}, {'number': 38, 'created': '2015-03-11 05:49:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/aa2f898b15a86330420e9b664eb44750cf83bea0', 'message': 'Retrieve domain scoped token

This patch supports using domain scoped tokens against keystone v3.

Use Cases:

Cloud Admin - view and manage identity resources across domains
Domain Admin - view and manage identity resources in the domain logged in
User - view identity project in the domain logged in

Regression:

Supports keystone v2 through local_settings.py configuration
Supports keystone v3 with multidomain = False
Supports keystone v3 with mulitdomain = True

Relates to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141153/

Background on how to test is here
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Co-Authored-By: daniel-a-nguyen <dan.nguyens.mail@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: woomatt <matt.wood@hp.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens

This patch supports using domain scoped tokens against keystone v3.

Use Cases:

Cloud Admin - view and manage identity resources across domains
Domain Admin - view and manage identity resources in the domain logged in
User - view identity project in the domain logged in

Regression:

Supports keystone v3 with multidomain = False
Supports keystone v3 with mulitdomain = True

Relates to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141153/

Background on how to test is here

commit_message:
Retrieve domain scoped token

This patch supports using domain scoped tokens against keystone v3.

Use Cases:

Cloud Admin - view and manage identity resources across domains
Domain Admin - view and manage identity resources in the domain logged in
User - view identity project in the domain logged in

Regression:

Supports keystone v2 through local_settings.py configuration
Supports keystone v3 with multidomain = False
Supports keystone v3 with mulitdomain = True

Relates to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141153/

Background on how to test is here
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/DomainWorkFlow

Co-Authored-By: Brad Pokorny <Brad_Pokorny@symantec.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Hagedorn <mike.hagedorn@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: woomatt <matt.wood@hp.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens

Closes-Bug: #1413851
Change-Id: Iaa19bfef9b0c70304ff81d083c62b218b2d02479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/82/148082/48 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: token_id = user.token.id if api_version >= 3: domain_context = request.session.get('domain_context', None) if domain_context: token_id = domain_context.id conn = api_version['client'].Client(token=token_id, # V2 API # TODO(esp): check user role, only do this if not cloud admin # V3 Domain Admin or User # tenants = manager.list(domain=domain, user=user) # V3 Cloud Admin tenants = manager.list()

commit_message:
Add ngSwift container actions

This patch adds container actions (create, delete, control is_public)
to the angular Swift interface.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1921_project_ng_containers_panel.py

Change-Id: Ifd25809f5caf1c7f9bfb908934cc60f5fa2e34fe
Co-Author: Neill Cox <neill@ingenious.com.au>
Co-Author: Diana Whitten <hurgleburgler@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-swift
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/36/259236/27 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
Upload Object To Container: {$ctrl.model.container.name$}

Description:

Object: An object is the basic storage entity that represents a file you store in the OpenStack Object Storage system. When you upload data to OpenStack Object Storage, the data is stored as-is (no compression or encryption) and consists of a location (container), the object's name, and any metadata consisting of key/value pairs.

Pseudo-folder: Within a container you can group your objects into pseudo-folders, which behave similarly to folders in your desktop operating system, with the exception that they are virtual collections defined by a common prefix on the object's name. A slash (/) character is used as the delimiter for pseudo-folders in the Object Store.

Cancel

subject: Add ngSwift object actions

commit_message:
Add ngSwift object actions

This patch adds object actions to the angular Swift interface
including viewing, download, upload etc.

This patch also adds a new "link" type to the action list
directives, which is used for file download links in the action
buttons. Additionally some event propogation issues are corrected
in the action buttons.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1921_project_ng_containers_panel.py

Co-Author: Diana Whitten <hurgleburgler@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-swift

added_lines:
Upload Object To Container: {$ctrl.model.container.name$}

Description:

Object: An object is the basic storage entity that represents a file you store in the OpenStack Object Storage system. When you upload data to OpenStack Object Storage, the data is stored as-is (no compression or encryption) and consists of a location (container), the object's name, and any metadata consisting of key/value pairs.

invalid: {$ uploadForm.$invalid $} pristine: {$ uploadForm.$pristine $}

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-14 17:45:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/5a13c941d4c28c80f62210938cb7916b5fc52221', 'message': 'Add Horizon support for volume consistency groups

Cinder has added support for creating and managing volume consistency
groups. This first patch adds this functionality into Horizon.
Subsequent patches will add features to utilize these consistency
groups - such as for creating snapshots.

Background/setup info:
This feaeture provides a Horizon interface to the Cinder consistency
groups (CG) API.   CGs allow a user to group a set of volumes together,
and then perform actions on all of the volumes in one command.

For example:
- Create CG snapshot. This will pause all volume I/O and create a
  snapshot for each volume in the CG at the same point in time.
- Create CG from another CG. This will clone a new set of volumes based
  on the current state of all volumes in the original CG.
- Create CG from CG snapshot. This will clone new set of volumes based
  on the saved state of all snapshots from the original CG snapshot.

This patch is limited to just creating consistency groups. A second
and final patch will add the snapshot features.

To run the patch, you will need to enable some consistency group
policies, which currently are defaulted to none, which means they
are disabled.

The policies are set in /etc/cinder/policy.json  they need to be set
to the following:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:update": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "rule:admin_or_owner",

    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "rule:admin_or_owner",

Once this is done, you will need to restart all 3 of the cinder
services in screen r (c-api, c-sch, and c-vol).

The new panel is a tab named Volume Consistency Groups and is
located in Project -> Volumes.

Change-Id: I33ebe39e79d7c1d1dc7e741b4199bcb259b642d1
Partially-implements: blueprint cinder-consistency-groups

Cinder has added support for creating and managing volume consistency
groups. This first patch adds this functionality into Horizon.
Subsequent patches will add features to utilize these consistency
groups - such as for creating snapshots.

Background/setup info:
This feature provides a Horizon interface to the Cinder consistency
groups (CG) API.   CGs allow a user to group a set of volumes together,
and then perform actions on all of the volumes in one command.

For example:
- Create CG snapshot. This will pause all volume I/O and create a
  snapshot for each volume in the CG at the same point in time.
- Create CG from another CG. This will clone a new set of volumes based
  on the current state of all volumes in the original CG.
- Create CG from CG snapshot. This will clone new set of volumes based
  on the saved state of all snapshots from the original CG snapshot.

This patch is limited to just creating consistency groups. A second
and final patch will add the snapshot features.

To run the patch, you will need to enable some consistency group
policies, which currently are defaulted to "none", which means they
are disabled.

The policies are set in /etc/cinder/policy.json - they need to be set
to the following:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:update": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "rule:admin_or_owner",

    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "rule:admin_or_owner",

Additionally, you must enable this feature by setting
'enable_consistency_groups' to True in your local_settings.py

The new panel is a tab named "Volume Consistency Groups" and is
located in "Project -> Volumes".

commit_message:
Add Horizon support for volume consistency groups

Cinder has added support for creating and managing volume consistency
groups. This first patch adds this functionality into Horizon.
Subsequent patches will add features to utilize these consistency
groups - such as for creating snapshots.

Background/setup info:
This feature provides a Horizon interface to the Cinder consistency
groups (CG) API.   CGs allow a user to group a set of volumes together,
and then perform actions on all of the volumes in one command.

For example:
- Create CG snapshot. This will pause all volume I/O and create a
  snapshot for each volume in the CG at the same point in time.
- Create CG from another CG. This will clone a new set of volumes based
  on the current state of all volumes in the original CG.
- Create CG from CG snapshot. This will clone new set of volumes based
  on the saved state of all snapshots from the original CG snapshot.

This patch is limited to just creating consistency groups. A second
and final patch will add the snapshot features.

To run the patch, you will need to enable some consistency group
policies, which currently are defaulted to "none", which means they
are disabled.

The policies are set in /etc/cinder/policy.json - they need to be set
to the following:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:update": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "rule:admin_or_owner",

    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "rule:admin_or_owner",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "rule:admin_or_owner",

Once this is done, you will need to restart all 3 of the cinder
services in "screen -r" (c-api, c-sch, and c-vol).

The new panel is a tab named "Volume Consistency Groups" and is
located in "Project -> Volumes".

Co-Authored-By: Brad Pokorny <brad_pokorny@symantec.com>
Change-Id: I33ebe39e79d7c1d1dc7e741b4199bcb259b642d1
Partially-implements: blueprint cinder-consistency-groups
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/30/257630/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse from django import http from mox3.mox import IsA # noqa from openstack_dashboard.api import cinder from openstack_dashboard.test import helpers as test class ConsistencyGroupTests(test.TestCase): @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_cgroup_create', 'volume_cgroup_list', 'volume_type_list', 'volume_type_list_with_qos_associations', 'availability_zone_list', 'extension_supported')}) def test_create_cgroup(self): cgroup = self.cinder_consistencygroups.first() volume_types = self.volume_types.list() az = self.cinder_availability_zones.first().zoneName formData = {'volume_types': '1', 'name': 'test CG', 'description': 'test desc', 'availability_zone': az} cinder.volume_type_list(IsA(http.HttpRequest)).\ AndReturn(volume_types) cinder.volume_type_list_with_qos_associations(IsA(http.HttpRequest)).\ AndReturn(volume_types) cinder.availability_zone_list(IsA(http.HttpRequest)).AndReturn( self.cinder_availability_zones.list()) cinder.extension_supported(IsA(http.HttpRequest), 'AvailabilityZones')\ .AndReturn(True) cinder.volume_cgroup_list(IsA( http.HttpRequest)).\ AndReturn(self.cinder_consistencygroups.list()) cinder.volume_cgroup_create( IsA(http.HttpRequest), formData['volume_types'], formData['name'], formData['description'], availability_zone=formData['availability_zone'])\ .AndReturn(cgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:project:volumes:cgroups:create') res = self.client.post(url, formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_cgroup_delete', 'volume_cgroup_list_with_vol_type_names')}) def test_delete_cgroup(self): cgroup = self.cinder_consistencygroups.first() cgroups = self.cinder_consistencygroups.list() cinder.volume_cgroup_list_with_vol_type_names(IsA(http.HttpRequest)).\ AndReturn(cgroups) cinder.volume_cgroup_delete(IsA(http.HttpRequest), cgroup.id) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:project:volumes:cgroups_tab') formData = {'action': 'volume_cgroups__delete__%s' % cgroup.id} res = self.client.post(url, formData, follow=True) self.assertIn("Scheduled deletion of Consistency Group: cg_1", [m.message for m in res.context['messages']]) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_cgroup_update', 'volume_cgroup_get')}) def test_update_cgroup_add_vol(self): cgroup = self.cinder_consistencygroups.first() volume = self.cinder_volumes.first() formData = {'volume_types': '1', 'name': 'test CG', 'description': 'test desc'} cinder.volume_cgroup_get(IsA( http.HttpRequest), cgroup.id).\ AndReturn(cgroup) cinder.volume_cgroup_update( IsA(http.HttpRequest), formData['name'], formData['description'], add_vols=volume)\ .AndReturn(cgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:project:volumes:cgroups:update', args=[cgroup.id]) res = self.client.post(url, formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res) @test.create_stubs({cinder: ('volume_cgroup_update', 'volume_cgroup_get')}) def test_update_cgroup_remove_vol(self): cgroup = self.cinder_consistencygroups.first() volume = self.cinder_volumes.first() formData = {'volume_types': '1', 'name': 'test CG', 'description': 'test desc'} cinder.volume_cgroup_get(IsA( http.HttpRequest), cgroup.id).\ AndReturn(cgroup) cinder.volume_cgroup_update( IsA(http.HttpRequest), formData['name'], formData['description'], remove_vols=volume)\ .AndReturn(cgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() url = reverse('horizon:project:volumes:cgroups:update', args=[cgroup.id]) res = self.client.post(url, formData) self.assertNoFormErrors(res)

subject: Add Network Port selection to new instance launch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-04 16:15:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/41a41eba47e20e3d20a6b1195ee9fa52bc74cc85', 'message': 'Add Network Port selection to new instance launch

Adds a new step to the new instance launch
with the available direct ports.
The operator can add or remove ports to be
attached to the instance on boot.
This allows the operator to use SR-IOV ports
at launch.
Adds tests and modifies other tests to take
into account the new number of steps and the
new addition to the model.

Change-Id: I29fdce433a5a8a9e3ebedbd1a1d96399890e4c6c
Implements: blueprint sriov-support

commit_message:
Add Network Port selection to new instance launch

Adds a new step to the new instance launch
with the available ports.
The operator can add or remove ports to be
attached to the instance on boot.
This allows the operator to use ports
at launch instead or together with a network.
Adds tests and modifies other tests to take
into account the new number of steps and the
new addition to the model.

Change-Id: I29fdce433a5a8a9e3ebedbd1a1d96399890e4c6c
Implements: blueprint allow-launching-ports

Change-Id: Id9718bb5d1c2b70664a9c27c67e91436e5489dd6

commit_message:
Horizon support for Heat template versions

This patch set adds "template_version_list" and
"template_function_list" methods.

Partially implements blueprint: heat-template-versions

Change-Id: Id9718bb5d1c2b70664a9c27c67e91436e5489dd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/73/292273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heatclient.v1 import template_versions TEST.template_versions = utils.TestDataContainer() TEST.template_functions = utils.TestDataContainer() # Template versions template_version_1 = template_versions.TemplateVersion( template_versions.TemplateVersionManager(None), { "version": "HeatTemplateFormatVersion.2012-12-12", "type": "cfn" }) template_version_2 = template_versions.TemplateVersion( template_versions.TemplateVersionManager(None), { "version": "heat_template_version.2013-05-23", "type": "hot" }) TEST.template_versions.add(template_version_1) TEST.template_versions.add(template_version_2) # Template functions template_function_1 = template_versions.TemplateVersion( template_versions.TemplateVersionManager(None), { "functions": "Fn::GetAZs", "description": "A function for retrieving the availability zones." }) template_function_2 = template_versions.TemplateVersion( template_versions.TemplateVersionManager(None), { "functions": "Fn::Join", "description": "A function for joining strings." }) TEST.template_functions.add(template_function_1) TEST.template_functions.add(template_function_2)

commit_message:
Added test for image create from local file

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage

Change-Id: Id1075a3812d4da020e78d2cd3266e7ab889cf2d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/98/293898/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os import path from urllib import urlretrieve if image_file is None: image_file = self.conf.image.local_image if not path.isfile(image_file): urlretrieve(self.conf.image.http_image, image_file)

commit_message:
Added tests for check change volume functionality

Tests check that upload volume to image and
extend volume actions are executed without errors.

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Ifc85b7a1f356e165ad46f4ffcaa2608e1ddccd4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/30/267630/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CHANGE_VOLUME_TYPE_FORM_FIELDS = (( "volume_type")) @tables.bind_row_action('retype') def change_type(self, change_type_button, row): change_type_button.click() return forms.FormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, None, self.CHANGE_VOLUME_TYPE_FORM_FIELDS) VOLUMES_TABLE_TYPE_COLUMN = 'volume_type' def change_type(self, name, new_type): row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(name) change_volume_type_form = self.volumes_table.change_type(row) change_volume_type_form.volume_type.text = new_type change_volume_type_form.submit() def is_volume_type(self, name, volume_type): row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(name) def cell_getter(): return row.cells[self.VOLUMES_TABLE_TYPE_COLUMN] try: self._wait_till_text_present_in_element(cell_getter, volume_type) except exceptions.TimeoutException: return False return True

commit_message:
Do not cache templates in DEBUG mode

During active development, when Django templates are changed
frequently it's more convenient to not cache them, thus avoiding
Django dev server restart each time the template was changed.

Change-Id: I7d6210a23a501c50db55cd68a202b11d4172128b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/76/281976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _LOADERS = ('django.template.loaders.filesystem.Loader', 'django.template.loaders.app_directories.Loader', 'horizon.loaders.TemplateLoader',) if TEMPLATE_DEBUG: TEMPLATE_LOADERS = _LOADERS else: TEMPLATE_LOADERS = (('django.template.loaders.cached.Loader', _LOADERS),)

added_lines: EDIT_CONSUMER_FORM_FIELDS = ("consumer_choice") @tables.bind_row_action('edit_consumer') def edit_consumer(self, edit_consumer_button, row): edit_consumer_button.click() return forms.FormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, None, self.EDIT_CONSUMER_FORM_FIELDS) QOS_SPECS_TABLE_CONSUMER_COLUMN = 'consumer' def edit_consumer(self, name, consumer_choice): row = self._get_row_with_qos_spec_name(name) edit_consumer_form = self.qos_specs_table.edit_consumer(row) edit_consumer_form.consumer_choice.value = consumer_choice edit_consumer_form.submit() def _get_consumer_from_row(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_qos_spec_name(name) return row.cells[self.QOS_SPECS_TABLE_CONSUMER_COLUMN].text def is_consumer_correct(self, qos_spec_name, consumer): actual_consumer = self._get_consumer_from_row(qos_spec_name) if actual_consumer == consumer: return True return False

commit_message:
Added test for check instances pagination functionality

-added test for instance creation/deletion functionality under regular user
-updated test for instance creation/deletion functionality under admin
-added tests for pagination instances under regular user and under admin
-added test for pagination and filtration instances under regular user and
under admin

Changes in TableRegion class:
1) _search_field_locator has been modified (now it works with both classes:
"table_search" and "table_search client")
2) _search_button_locator has been modified
3) filter() method has been updated
4) _search_option_locator and set_filter_value() method have been added

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: I6be5511e22644f85a53a781f417c5fde7fbf0275
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/88/269488/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_instances_pagination(self): """This test checks instance pagination Steps: 1) Login to Horizon Dashboard as admin 2) Navigate to user settings page 3) Change 'Items Per Page' value to 1 4) Go to Project -> Compute -> Instances page 5) Create 2 instances 6) Check that only 'Next' link is available, only one instance is available (and it has correct name) on the first page 7) Click 'Next' and check that on the second page only one instance is available (and it has correct name), there is no 'Next' link on page 8) Go to user settings page and restore 'Items Per Page' 9) Go to Project -> Compute -> Instances page and check filter by Instance Name in order to have one instance in the list (and it should have correct name) instead of two, and no 'Next' link is available. """ instance_name = helpers.gen_random_resource_name( 'instance', timestamp=False) items_per_page = 1 instance_count = 2 instance_list = ["{0}-{1}".format(instance_name, item) for item in range(1, 3)] first_page_definition = {'Next': True, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Name': [instance_list[1]]} second_page_definition = {'Next': False, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Name': [instance_list[0]]} filter_first_instance = {'Next': False, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Name': [instance_list[1]]} filter_both_instances = {'Next': False, 'Count': instance_count, 'Name': instance_list} settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize(items_per_page) settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_instancespage() instances_page.create_instance(instance_name, instance_count=instance_count) instances_page.instances_table.assert_definition(first_page_definition) instances_page.instances_table.next_page() instances_page.instances_table.assert_definition( second_page_definition) settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize() settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_instancespage() instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_list[1]) instances_page.instances_table.assert_definition(filter_first_instance) instances_page.instances_table.clear_search_field() instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_list[0]) instances_page.instances_table.assert_definition( second_page_definition) instances_page.instances_table.clear_search_field() instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_name) instances_page.instances_table.assert_definition(filter_both_instances) for i in range(2): instances_page.delete_instance(instance_list[i]) instances_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS)

commit_message:
Tests for instance filtering are added

Tests check that instance filtering actions are executed correctly under
regular user (Project > Compute > Instances page) and under admin user
(Admin > System > Instances page).

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: I453db55dd0d57e29245409b28484bc7199764b8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/271204/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_filter_instances(self): """This test checks filtering of instances by Instance Name Steps: 1) Login to Horizon dashboard as regular user 2) Go to Project > Compute > Instances 3) Create 2 instances 4) Use filter by Instance Name 5) Check that filtered table has one instance only (which name is equal to filter value) and no other instances in the table 6) Check that filtered table has both instances (search by common part of instance names) and no other instances in the table 7) Set nonexistent instance name. Check that 0 rows are displayed 8) Clear filter and delete instances from Project > Compute > Instances """ instance_name = helpers.gen_random_resource_name( 'instance', timestamp=False) instance_count = 2 instance_list = ["{0}-{1}".format(instance_name, item) for item in range(1, instance_count + 1)] instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_instancespage() instances_page.create_instance(instance_name, instance_count=instance_count) self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_active(instance_list[0])) actual_instance_list = [row.cells['name'].text for row in instances_page.instances_table.rows] instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_list[0]) self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance_list[0])) for instance in actual_instance_list: if instance not in instance_list[:1]: self.assertFalse(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance)) instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_name) for instance in instance_list: self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance)) for instance in actual_instance_list: if instance not in instance_list: self.assertFalse(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance)) nonexistent_instance_name = "{0}_test".format(instance_name) instances_page.instances_table.filter(nonexistent_instance_name) self.assertEqual(instances_page.instances_table.rows, []) instances_page.instances_table.filter('') for instance in instance_list: instances_page.delete_instance(instance) instances_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_deleted(instance)) def test_filter_instances_under_admin(self): """This test checks filtering of instances by Name under admin Steps: 1) Login to Horizon dashboard as admin 2) Go to Project > Compute > Instances 3) Create 2 instances 4) Go to Admin > System > Instances 5) Select filter by Name 6) Check that filtered table has one instance only (which name is equal to filter value) and no other instances in the table 7) Check that filtered table has both instances (search by common part of instance names) and no other instances in the table 8) Set nonexistent instance name. Check that 0 rows are displayed 9) Clear filter and delete instances from Admin > System > Instances """ instance_name = helpers.gen_random_resource_name( 'instance', timestamp=False) instance_count = 2 instance_list = ["{0}-{1}".format(instance_name, item) for item in range(1, instance_count + 1)] instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_instancespage() instances_page.create_instance(instance_name, instance_count=instance_count) self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_active(instance_list[0])) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_instancespage() actual_instance_list = [row.cells['name'].text for row in instances_page.instances_table.rows] instances_page.instances_table.set_filter_value('name') instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_list[0]) self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance_list[0])) for instance in actual_instance_list: if instance not in instance_list[:1]: self.assertFalse(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance)) instances_page.instances_table.filter(instance_name) for instance in instance_list: self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance)) for instance in actual_instance_list: if instance not in instance_list: self.assertFalse(instances_page.is_instance_present(instance)) nonexistent_instance_name = "{0}_test".format(instance_name) instances_page.instances_table.filter(nonexistent_instance_name) self.assertEqual(instances_page.instances_table.rows, []) instances_page.instances_table.filter('') for instance in instance_list: instances_page.delete_instance(instance) instances_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(instances_page.is_instance_deleted(instance))

commit_message:
Fix remaining Django 1.9 test failures

This patch gets Horizon to a passing state in the Django 1.9 tests

Co-Authored-By: Itxaka <iserrano@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Icbc1a3c039de658faa9fba4a2cdd5027345fe94d
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-dj17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/22/280222/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import djangofrom six import moves if django.VERSION >= (1, 9): self.assertRedirects(resp, settings.TESTSERVER + redirect_url) else: self.assertRedirects(resp, redirect_url)
deleted_lines: from six import moves self.assertRedirects(resp, redirect_url)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 19:41:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/9de723185feb768ec5e6c2eb2d219b577a0cc4b9', 'message': 'Update URLs to Django 1.8+ style

commit_message:
Update URLs to Django 1.8+ style

Django 1.8 altered and deprecated the existing pattern for defining
URLs. This will be removed in 1.10, meaning that many deprecation
warnings show up under Django 1.9. We should fix the URLs promptly to
avoid logspam, and to support Django 1.10 in Newton.

See
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/releases/1.8/#django-conf-urls-patterns

Change-Id: I074d20850de59bfe678a3bc72e9f0f25bd743cbf
Partially-Implements: blueprint dj110
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/01/280901/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.views import defaults from openstack_dashboard.api import restfrom openstack_dashboard import viewsurlpatterns = [ url(r'^$', views.splash, name='splash'), url(r'^api/', include(rest.urls)),] urlpatterns.append(url(r'^500/$', defaults.server_error))
deleted_lines: from django.conf.urls import patternsurlpatterns = patterns( '', url(r'^$', 'openstack_dashboard.views.splash', name='splash'), url(r'^api/', include('openstack_dashboard.api.rest.urls')),) urlpatterns += patterns( '', url(r'^500/$', 'django.views.defaults.server_error') )

commit_message:
Add test for check router create, edit, delete from Admin page

Create both test for router create/edit/delete(Admin->System->Routers)
and router Page Object. Also decapitalize routers table name for
Admin page so it could be referenced in integration tests like any
other table.

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Ifb3dbfdade0071fc25417985bead3656044ac0a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/70/275170/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestAdminRouters(helpers.AdminTestCase): def test_router_create_admin(self): admin_routers_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_routerspage() self.assertTrue(routers_page.is_router_present(self.ROUTER_NAME)) self.assertTrue(routers_page.is_router_active(self.ROUTER_NAME)) new_name = "edited_" + self.ROUTER_NAME admin_routers_page.edit_router(self.ROUTER_NAME, new_name, "DOWN") admin_routers_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS)) self.assertFalse( admin_routers_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.ERROR)) self.assertTrue( admin_routers_page.is_router_present(new_name)) self.assertTrue( admin_routers_page.is_router_active(new_name)) admin_routers_page.delete_router(new_name) self.assertTrue( admin_routers_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS)) self.assertFalse( admin_routers_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.ERROR)) self.assertFalse(admin_routers_page.is_router_present(new_name))

commit_message:
Added router set/clear gateway test.

Change-Id: Ia6369b43a0fa9e9b9c42b1b93c8455e87563c06d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/76/266776/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SET_GATEWAY_FORM_FIELDS = ("network_id", "router_name", "router_id") @tables.bind_row_action('cleargateway', primary=True) def clear_gateway(self, clear_gateway_button, row): clear_gateway_button.click() return forms.BaseFormRegion(self.driver, self.conf) @tables.bind_row_action('setgateway', primary=True) def set_gateway(self, set_gateway_button, row): set_gateway_button.click() return forms.FormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, None, self.SET_GATEWAY_FORM_FIELDS) ROUTERS_TABLE_NETWORK_COLUMN = 'ext_net' def set_gateway(self, router_id, network_id=DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_NETWORK): row = self._get_row_with_router_name(router_id) def get_router_name(): return row.cells[self.ROUTERS_TABLE_NAME_COLUMN] set_gateway_form = self.routers_table.set_gateway(row) set_gateway_form.network_id.text = network_id set_gateway_form.router_name.value = get_router_name() set_gateway_form.router_id.value = router_id set_gateway_form.submit() self.wait_till_popups_disappear() def clear_gateway(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_router_name(name) confirm_clear_gateway_form = self.routers_table.clear_gateway(row) confirm_clear_gateway_form.submit() self.wait_till_popups_disappear() def is_gateway_cleared(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_router_name(name) def cell_getter(): return row.cells[self.ROUTERS_TABLE_NETWORK_COLUMN] try: self._wait_till_text_present_in_element(cell_getter, '-') except exceptions.TimeoutException: return False return True def is_gateway_set(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_router_name(name) def cell_getter(): return row.cells[self.ROUTERS_TABLE_NETWORK_COLUMN] try: self._wait_till_text_present_in_element(cell_getter, 'public') except exceptions.TimeoutException: return False return True

commit_message:
Added test for check launch volume as instance functionality

Tests check that launch as instance actions are executed correctly for volume
under regular user.

Change-Id: I79bd0f75ab88d82d43ee7232ded4157dfd51866e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/54/276654/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LAUNCH_INSTANCE_FORM_FIELDS = (( "availability_zone", "name", "flavor", "count", "source_type", "volume_id", "vol_delete_on_instance_delete"), ("keypair", "groups"), ("script_source", "script_upload", "script_data"), ("disk_config", "config_drive") ) @tables.bind_row_action('launch_volume') def launch_volume_as_instance(self, launch_volume_button, row): launch_volume_button.click() return forms.TabbedFormRegion( self.driver, self.conf, field_mappings=self.LAUNCH_INSTANCE_FORM_FIELDS) def launch_instance(self, name, instance_name, available_zone=None): row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(name) instance_form = self.volumes_table.launch_volume_as_instance(row) if not available_zone: available_zone = self.conf.launch_instances.available_zone instance_form.availability_zone.value = available_zone instance_form.name.text = instance_name instance_form.submit() def get_attach_instance(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(name) attach_instance = row.cells[self.VOLUMES_TABLE_ATTACHED_COLUMN].text return attach_instance

commit_message:
Tests for images filtering are added

test_images.py reworked according to approach from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273467/

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: I4e35ee864167a45dbe760505ca2be1bd68ddf63a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/73/270773/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_filter_images(self): """This test checks filtering of images Steps: 1) Login to Horizon dashboard as admin user 2) Go to Admin -> System -> Images 3) Use filter by Image Name 4) Check that filtered table has one image only (which name is equal to filter value) 5) Check that no other images in the table 6) Clear filter and set nonexistent image name. Check that 0 rows are displayed """ images_list = self.CONFIG.image.images_list images_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_imagespage() images_page.images_table.filter(images_list[0]) self.assertTrue(images_page.is_image_present(images_list[0])) for image in images_list[1:]: self.assertFalse(images_page.is_image_present(image)) nonexistent_image_name = "{0}_test".format(self.IMAGE_NAME) images_page.images_table.filter(nonexistent_image_name) self.assertEqual(images_page.images_table.rows, []) images_page.images_table.filter('') def test_images_pagination_with_filter(self): """This test checks filtering of images in case of filter using Steps: 1) Login to Horizon dashboard as admin user 2) Go to Admin -> System -> Images 3) Create 3 images with the same name 4) Set this name as value of filer by image name 5) Check that table is expected one: no 'Next'/'Prev' links, count of rows is 3, list of images names is expected also 6) Go to the user settings and change 'Items per page' to 2 7) Go to Admin -> System -> Images 8) Check 1st table page: no 'Prev' link, 'Next' is available, count of rows is 2, list of images names is expected also 9) Click 'Next' and check the 2nd table page: no 'Next' link, 'Prev' is available, count of rows is 1, list of names is expected 10) Click 'Prev' and check table page. Should be the same as for step8 """ images_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_imagespage() images_count = 3 images_names = [] for i in xrange(images_count): images_page.create_image(self.IMAGE_NAME) images_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) images_names.extend( [row.cells['name'].text for row in images_page.images_table.rows if row.cells['name'].text == self.IMAGE_NAME]) self.assertEqual(len(images_names), images_count) images_page.images_table.filter(self.IMAGE_NAME) filtered_table_without_pagination = {'Next': False, 'Prev': False, 'Count': images_count, 'Names': images_names} images_page.images_table. \ assert_definition(filtered_table_without_pagination) items_per_page = 2 settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize(items_per_page) settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) first_table_with_pagination = {'Next': True, 'Prev': False, 'Count': items_per_page, 'Names': images_names[:items_per_page]} second_table_with_pagination = {'Next': False, 'Prev': True, 'Count': images_count - items_per_page, 'Names': images_names[items_per_page:]} images_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_imagespage() images_page.images_table.assert_definition(first_table_with_pagination) images_page.images_table.turn_next_page() images_page.images_table. \ assert_definition(second_table_with_pagination) images_page.images_table.turn_prev_page() images_page.images_table.assert_definition(first_table_with_pagination) settings_page = self.home_pg.go_to_settings_usersettingspage() settings_page.change_pagesize() settings_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) images_page = self.home_pg.go_to_system_imagespage() images_page.images_table.filter('') while images_names: images_page.delete_image(images_names.pop()) images_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS) self.assertFalse(images_page.is_image_present(self.IMAGE_NAME))

commit_message:
Added update image metadata test

Updated forms.py with MetadataFormRegion.
Updated tables.py with method to bind anchor row column.
Added test for update image metadata.

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Idd3651955b8f0e1a0c08dd43abd657aafa5a3bc2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/49/271249/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def image_create_delete(self, image_source): images_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_imagespage() images_page.create_image(self.IMAGE_NAME, image_source_type=image_source) self.assertTrue(images_page.is_image_present(self.IMAGE_NAME)) self.assertTrue(images_page.is_image_active(self.IMAGE_NAME)) images_page.delete_image(self.IMAGE_NAME) self.assertFalse(images_page.is_image_present(self.IMAGE_NAME)) def test_url_image_create_delete(self): self.image_create_delete(image_source='url') def test_local_image_create_delete(self): """tests the image creation and deletion functionalities: * downloads the file stated in horizon.conf http_image * creates a new image from downloaded file * verifies the image appears in the images table as active * deletes the newly created image * verifies the image does not appear in the table after deletion """ self.image_create_delete(image_source='file')
deleted_lines: def test_image_create_delete(self): images_page = self.home_pg.go_to_compute_imagespage() images_page.create_image(self.IMAGE_NAME) self.assertTrue(images_page.is_image_present(self.IMAGE_NAME)) self.assertTrue(images_page.is_image_active(self.IMAGE_NAME)) images_page.delete_image(self.IMAGE_NAME) self.assertFalse(images_page.is_image_present(self.IMAGE_NAME))

commit_message:
Adding Edit Image Action to angular images panel

Adds the ability to edit an image from the table.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

Also, ensure in your local_settings.py that you set:
REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS to include 'OPENSTACK_IMAGE_FORMATS'

Co-Authored-By: Rajat Vig<rajatv@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nathan Zeplowitz<nzeplowi@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Olivo<keolivo@thoughtworks.com>

Change-Id: I046eca486ebc0d2d980ee706105e202bf9b15ba8
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Support scheduler hints when launching instance

This adds the Scheduler Hints step to the angular Launch Instance
workflow and allows specifying arbitrary hints when launching an
instance. It also displays available hints from the glance metadata
definitions catalog OS::Nova::Server namespace that use the
"scheduler_hints" properties target.

Implements: blueprint add-scheduler-hints
Change-Id: Ic33c31e645f45b7a4cbdf13e9a115c96399d5e32

commit_message:
Added tests for check RC files from API Access page

test_download_rc_v2_file()
test_download_rc_v3_file()

Tests check that RC files are downloaded successfully and
some attributes of file's contents are correct.

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Icef46863a6fb95600f7c98d5926cfb5b0dfa3d92

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import re from selenium.webdriver.common import by from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.pages import basepage class ApiaccessPage(basepage.BaseNavigationPage): _download_openstack_rc_v2_locator = ( by.By.ID, "endpoints__action_download_openrc_v2" ) _download_openstack_rc_v3_locator = ( by.By.ID, "endpoints__action_download_openrc" ) _view_credential_locator = ( by.By.ID, "endpoints__action_view_credentials" ) def __init__(self, driver, conf): super(ApiaccessPage, self).__init__(driver, conf) self._page_title = "Access & Security" @property def download_openstack_rc_v2(self): return self._get_element(*self._download_openstack_rc_v2_locator) @property def download_openstack_rc_v3(self): return self._get_element(*self._download_openstack_rc_v3_locator) @property def view_credentail(self): return self._get_element(*self._view_credential_locator)

commit_message:
Add test for volumes attach/detach

test_volumes.py has been reworked according to approach
from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273467/

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: I5fa417d9847569cf7993c850a77ddcf776d79927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/31/275231/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By @tables.bind_row_action('attachments') def manage_attachments(self, manage_attachments, row): manage_attachments.click() return forms.BaseFormRegion(self.driver, self.conf) VOLUMES_TABLE_ATTACHMENTS_COLUMN = 'attachments' def attach_volume_to_instance(self, volume, instance): attach_to_instance_selector = (By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'select[name="instance"]') row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(volume) attach_form = self.volumes_table.manage_attachments(row) instance_selector = \ attach_form._get_element(*attach_to_instance_selector) instance_to_select = [option.text for option in self._get_dropdown_options(instance_selector) if option.text.startswith(instance)][0] self._select_dropdown(instance_to_select, instance_selector) attach_form.submit() def is_volume_attached_to_instance(self, volume, instance): row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(volume) return row.cells[ self.VOLUMES_TABLE_ATTACHMENTS_COLUMN].text.startswith( "Attached to {0}".format(instance)) def detach_volume_from_instance(self, volume, instance): row = self._get_row_with_volume_name(volume) self.volumes_table.manage_attachments(row) detach_button = (By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'tr[data-display="Volume {0} on instance {1}"] button' .format(volume, instance)) self._get_element(*detach_button).click() self._get_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, '*.btn.btn-primary').click()

commit_message:
Added test for check stacks creation and deletion functionality

Test checks that create/delete stacks actions are executed without
errors under admin user.
Stacks page object was defined similar to other pages.

Few other modifications I've made:
* horizon.conf - service_available section with new heat option
* stack template is added as separate file

Depends-On: I1f5dc1220aee39103289a579583095346cce0354
Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Ibc549f9ae4eac17d8e92d65afe1c5cee9be6e72e

added_lines: EDIT_IMAGE_FORM_FIELDS = ( "name", "description", "disk_format", "minimum_disk", "minimum_ram", "public", "protected" ) @tables.bind_row_action('delete') def delete_image_via_row_action(self, delete_button, row): delete_button.click() return forms.BaseFormRegion(self.driver, self.conf) @tables.bind_row_action('edit') def edit_image(self, edit_button, row): edit_button.click() return forms.FormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, field_mappings=self.EDIT_IMAGE_FORM_FIELDS) def edit_image(self, name, description=None, minimum_disk=None, minimum_ram=None, public=None, protected=None): row = self._get_row_with_image_name(name) confirm_edit_images_form = self.images_table.edit_image(row) protected_is_marked = confirm_edit_images_form.protected.is_marked() public_is_marked = confirm_edit_images_form.public.is_marked() if description is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.description.text = description if minimum_disk is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.minimum_disk.value = minimum_disk if minimum_ram is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.minimum_ram.value = minimum_ram if public is True and not public_is_marked: confirm_edit_images_form.public.mark() if public is False and public_is_marked: confirm_edit_images_form.public.unmark() if protected is True and not protected_is_marked: confirm_edit_images_form.protected.mark() if protected is False and protected_is_marked: confirm_edit_images_form.protected.unmark() confirm_edit_images_form.submit() def delete_image_via_row_action(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_image_name(name) delete_image_form = self.images_table.delete_image_via_row_action(row) delete_image_form.submit()

commit_message:
Security group add/delete rules integration tests

Added tests to validate add/delete rules in security groups

Change-Id: If2ec1108cdcc59d9ce7f24a07ead82e071d49ccf
Implements: blueprint horizon-integration-tests-coverage
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/26/306526/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.pages import basepage from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.regions import forms from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.regions import tables class RulesTable(tables.TableRegion): name = 'rules' ADD_RULE_FORM_FIELDS = ("rule_menu", "direction", "port_or_range", "port", "remote", "cidr") @tables.bind_table_action('add_rule') def create_rule(self, create_button): create_button.click() return forms.FormRegion( self.driver, self.conf, field_mappings=self.ADD_RULE_FORM_FIELDS) @tables.bind_table_action('delete') def delete_rules_by_table(self, delete_button): delete_button.click() return forms.BaseFormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, None) @tables.bind_row_action('delete') def delete_rule_by_row(self, delete_button, row): delete_button.click() return forms.BaseFormRegion(self.driver, self.conf, None) class ManageRulesPage(basepage.BaseNavigationPage): RULES_TABLE_PORT_RANGE_COLUMN = 'port_range' def __init__(self, driver, conf): super(ManageRulesPage, self).__init__(driver, conf) self._page_title = "Manage Security Group Rules - OpenStack Dashboard" def _get_row_with_port_range(self, port): return self.rules_table.get_row( self.RULES_TABLE_PORT_RANGE_COLUMN, port) @property def rules_table(self): return RulesTable(self.driver, self.conf) def create_rule(self, port): create_rule_form = self.rules_table.create_rule() create_rule_form.port.text = port create_rule_form.submit() def delete_rule(self, port): row = self._get_row_with_port_range(port) modal_confirmation_form = self.rules_table.delete_rule_by_row(row) modal_confirmation_form.submit() def delete_rules(self, port): row = self._get_row_with_port_range(port) row.mark() modal_confirmation_form = self.rules_table.delete_rules_by_table() modal_confirmation_form.submit() def is_port_present(self, port): return bool(self._get_row_with_port_range(port))

commit_message:
Initial Clean Up Old Styles in _debt.scss

Unnecessary Styles:
 * #create_container_form .modal-footer
 * .list-bullet
 * dt

Can't find usage:
 * .btn-inline
 * #actions.single
 * div.input input[type="checkbox"]
 * .item_detail

Not used any longer:
 * .modal-body fieldset .form-field select[data-add-item-url

Change-Id: Ibfeeec84a58d4dffaa669fc48f27cac02a2011c7
Partially-implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Provide another way for developers to create an Angular Table Header
vs HTML markup.  The plan is that this will simplify creation of the
table content too (e.g we don't have to rewrite the responsive
priority 'rsp-p1' between header and content and accidently copy
it wrong) because we can reuse some components.

To test, set DISABLED = FALSE in _3031_identity_users_panel.py.
Then go to last Users panel in the Identity menu.

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-03 20:39:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/af58dd7ad2821b8afe982b4e6a558d2c0aa2b365', 'message': 'WIP Angular Table Directive

Provide another way for developers to programatically declare
an Angular Table vs HTML markup.

You need to pass in items and a column configuration object.
The configuration object contains: name (to show data), title
(what the column header is actually called), cssClasses, sortId,
sortDefault, and an optional template. Template is HTML markup for
cells in that specific column. It is used to show the data in a more
complex manner than just the name - item[column.name]

To test, set DISABLED = False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py.
Then go to last Users panel in the Identity menu.

Change-Id: Id8ca0d13ed79030a85aaf3daaee1335ead5344f5

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-02-11 23:21:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/785c3e45269a5e609698804b363d31ba715caee7', 'message': 'Angular Table Directive

Provide another way for developers to programatically declare
an Angular Table vs writing HTML markup.

You need to pass in the data and the columns definition into
hz-dynamic-table.

This definition includes selectAll, expand as well as an list
of all the columns we want to display. For each column, provide
 name (to show data), title (what the column header is actually called),
cssClasses, sortId, sortDefault, and an optional template.
(Template is HTML markup for cells in that specific column.
It is used to show the data in a more complex manner than
just the name - item[column.name])

To test, pull down the dependent demo patch on the Users Table and set
DISABLED = False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py.
Then go to last Users panel in the Identity menu.

Change-Id: Id8ca0d13ed79030a85aaf3daaee1335ead5344f5
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

'}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2016-02-25 23:48:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/98a6db6ed3fdf6822e4b3d2128039c17fbffe303', 'message': 'WIP Angular Table Directive

Provide another way for developers to programatically declare
an Angular Table vs writing HTML markup.

You need to pass in the data, columns definition, any batch actions,
and row actions into hz-dynamic-table.

This definition includes selectAll, expand as well as a list
of all the columns we want to display. For each column, provide
 name (to show data), title (what the column header is actually called),
cssClasses, sortId, sortDefault, any filters on the column,
and an optional template. (Template is HTML markup for cells in that
specific column. It is used to show the data in a more complex manner than
just the name - item[column.name])

To test, pull down the dependent demo patch on the Users Table or the
Images table and set DISABLED = False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py
or _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py, respectively.
Then go to last Users panel in the Identity menu or the last Images table
in the Projects menu.

Change-Id: Id8ca0d13ed79030a85aaf3daaee1335ead5344f5
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-table-directive

in the Projects menu.

commit_message:
Angular Table Directive

Provide another way for developers to programatically declare
an Angular Table vs writing HTML markup.

You need to pass in the data, column definition, any batch actions,
and item/row actions into hz-dynamic-table.

The column definition includes
- selectAll
- expand
- a list of all the columns we want to display, For each column, provide
 name (to show data), title (what the column header is actually called),
priority, sortDefault, any filters on the column,
and an optional template. (Template is HTML markup for cells in that
specific column. It is used to show the data in a more complex manner than
just the name - item[column.name])

To test, pull down the dependent demo patch on the Users Table or the
Images table and set DISABLED = False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py
or _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py, respectively.
Then go to last Users panel in the Identity menu or the last Images table
in the Projects menu.

Change-Id: Id8ca0d13ed79030a85aaf3daaee1335ead5344f5
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-table-directive

deleted_lines: Include select-col if you want to select all. Include expander if you want to inline details. Include action-col if you want to perform actions. <tr> <th class="select-col"><input type="checkbox" hz-select-all="table.iusers"></th> <th class="expander"></th> <th class="rsp-p1" st-sort="name" st-sort-default="name" translate>User Name</th> <th class="rsp-p2" st-sort="email" translate>Email</th> <th class="rsp-p1" st-sort="tenantId||default_project_id" translate>User ID</th> <th class="rsp-p2 text-center" st-sort="enabled" translate>Enabled</th>

commit_message:
Improve Router integration tests coverage

Added test to verify that the Router add/delete interface functionality
is executed without errors under normal user credentials for:
Project > Network > Routers > Router panel

Added test to verify the Router delete interface by row action
functionality is executed without errors under normal user credentials

Added test to verify the Router Overveiw data is displayed as expected
and the navigation to linked resources works correctly

Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage

Change-Id: I65ee739b2145fe84c2d3a2f005030abdddf8339a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/93/304693/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @property def routers_page(self): return self.home_pg.go_to_network_routerspage() def _create_router(self): routers_page = self.routers_page def _delete_router(self): routers_page = self.routers_page def test_router_create(self): """tests the router creation and deletion functionalities: * creates a new router for public network * verifies the router appears in the routers table as active * deletes the newly created router * verifies the router does not appear in the table after deletion """ self._create_router() self._delete_router() def test_router_add_delete_interface(self): """Tests the router interface creation and deletion functionalities: * Follows the steps to create a new router * Clicks on the new router name from the routers table * Moves to the Interfaces page/tab * Adds a new Interface for the first subnet id available * Verifies the new interface is in the routers table by checking the length of the table rows * Deletes the newly created interface * Verifies the interface is no longer in the interfaces table by checking the length of the table rows * Switches to the routers view by clicking on the breadcrumb link * Follows the steps to delete the router """ self._create_router() routers_page = self.routers_page router_interfaces_page = routers_page.\ go_to_interfaces_page(self.ROUTER_NAME) interfaces_length = router_interfaces_page.interfaces_length router_interfaces_page.create_interface() self.assertTrue( router_interfaces_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS)) self.assertFalse( router_interfaces_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.ERROR)) self.assertTrue(interfaces_length < router_interfaces_page.interfaces_length) self.assertTrue(router_interfaces_page.is_interface_status('Down')) router_interfaces_page.delete_interface() self.assertTrue( router_interfaces_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.SUCCESS)) self.assertFalse( router_interfaces_page.find_message_and_dismiss(messages.ERROR)) self.assertEqual(interfaces_length, router_interfaces_page.interfaces_length) router_interfaces_page.switch_to_routers_page() self._delete_router()
deleted_lines: def test_router_create(self): """tests the router creation and deletion functionalities: * creates a new router for public network * verifies the router appears in the routers table as active * deletes the newly created router * verifies the router does not appear in the table after deletion """ routers_page = self.home_pg.go_to_network_routerspage()

commit_message:
Provide integration test for managing a project's members

A new MembershipMenuRegion was implemented specifically for the task
of dealing with Users being assigned to a Projects. It may be re-used
in other tests as well, which deal with the same membership concept
(e.g., Flavor Access control).

The checker method .is_the_current_page() is changed to act either as
a boolean method, or as an internal assert method.

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Implements blueprint: horizon-integration-tests-coverage
Change-Id: Ie661a1522951e1e86c461c6ec284fcf4a3e6d6fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/35/168935/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from selenium.webdriver.common import by from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.regions import baseregion class ProjectMembersTab(baseregion.BaseRegion): _get_added_members_locator = ( by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'ul.members.update_members_members > ul') _add_member_locator = ( '//li[@class="dropdown role_options open"]/ul/' 'li[contains(text(),"Member")]') def _user_name_locator(self, position): element = ( by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'ul.members.update_members_members > ' 'ul:nth-of-type(%d) span.display_name' % (int(position))) return element def _get_user_role_locator(self, position): element = ( by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'ul.members.update_members_members > ' 'ul:nth-of-type(%d) li.selected' % (int(position))) return element def _dropdown_locator(self, user_name): element = ( by.By.XPATH, '//ul[@class="members update_members_members"]' '//span[contains(text(),"%s")]/../../' 'li[@class="dropdown role_options"]/a' % user_name) return element def _member_by_name_locator(self, name): element = ( by.By.XPATH, '//ul[@class="available_members available_update_members"]' '//span[contains(text(),"%s")]/../../li[@class="active"]/a' % name) return element def _del_member_locator(self, name): element = ( by.By.XPATH, '//ul[@class="members update_members_members"]' '//span[contains(text(),"%s")]/../../li[@class="active"]/a' % name) return element def _set_user_role_locator(self, role): element = ( by.By.XPATH, '//li[@class="dropdown role_options open"]/ul/' 'li[contains(text(),"%s")]' % role) return element @property def get_added_members(self): return self._get_elements(*self._get_added_members_locator) def _add_member_by_name(self, name): # user always have role by default self._get_element(*self._member_by_name_locator(name)).click() def _del_member_by_name(self, name): self._get_element(*self._del_member_locator(name)).click() def _change_member_roles(self, name, *roles): # remove all old roles and set new self._del_member_by_name(name) self._add_member_and_roles(name, *roles) def add_member_and_roles(self, users_roles): for user_roles in users_roles: self._add_member_and_roles(*user_roles) def _add_member_and_roles(self, name, *roles): # use example: _add_member_and_roles("user_name", "admin", "Member") # default _member_ role will be remove, if you need this role # please will add her to role-list self._add_member_by_name(name) # NOTE(vokhrimenko): double-click is need, # user one click in browser doesn't enough self._get_element(*self._dropdown_locator(name)).click() self._get_element(*self._dropdown_locator(name)).click() if roles: self._get_role_member = (by.By.XPATH, self._add_member_locator) self._get_element(*self._get_role_member).click() for role in roles: self._get_element(*self._set_user_role_locator(role)).click() def get_list_users_and_roles(self, numbers_added_users): # return tuple with tuples lists_added_users = [] for i in range(1, numbers_added_users + 1): list_added_users = [] user_name = self._get_element(*self._user_name_locator(i)) list_added_users.append(str(user_name.text)) # NOTE(vokhrimenko): double-click is need, # user one click in browser doesn't enough self._get_element(*self._dropdown_locator(user_name.text)).click() self._get_element(*self._dropdown_locator(user_name.text)).click() user_roles = self._get_elements(*self._get_user_role_locator(i)) for role in user_roles: list_added_users.append(str(role.text)) lists_added_users.append(tuple(list_added_users)) return tuple(lists_added_users) def comparison_lists_users_and_roles(self, list_1, list_2): if len(list_1) == len(list_2): for i in range(len(list_1)): if len(list_1[i]) == len(list_2[i]): for k in list_1[i]: if k not in list_2[i]: return False else: return False else: return False return True

subject: Enhances tox to not rely on run_tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 13:49:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6a30ff75654fec39b2b89b36d9ec90d1207566a2', 'message': 'Enhances tox to not rely on run_tests

Several changes:
 - Dont rely on run_tests.sh and run the commands directly
 - Move the coverage options to the setup.cfg
 - Set py27 envs under the same umbrella
 - Split horizon and openstack_dashboard tests into 2
different envs
 - Remove usedevelop as its not needed
 - Set basepython to 27 on the default env
 - Allow adding posargs to py34 env
 - Add the karma tests as a new env
 - Add runserver as a new env
 - Remove the check translations from teh pep8 check

Change-Id: Ia1be8f60265d9dab2639a05912b4b7c51f1d4033
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 14:03:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/82150692ee7cc2d2c5bd4dcd5b4ba6172cc35898', 'message': 'Enhances tox to not rely on run_tests

Several changes:
 - Dont rely on run_tests.sh and run the commands directly
 - Move the coverage options to the setup.cfg
 - Set py27 envs under the same umbrella
 - Split horizon and openstack_dashboard tests into 2
different envs
 - Remove usedevelop as its not needed
 - Set basepython to 27 on the default env
 - Allow adding posargs to py34 env
 - Add the karma tests as a new env
 - Add runserver as a new env
 - Move pep8 to be the first tests so we dont have to wait
 - Provide an env to tests against system packages, useful
for package builders that DONT want to test against pip
install but their local packages installation.
 - Allow to pass TOX_EXTRA_DEPS to the system_packages
tests in case some pip packages are needed
 - Add a manage env to pass commands to manage.py
for all test to run if there is pep8 failures
 - Add an environment to createmessages
 - Add an environment to check only if we can create
messages
 - pep8 environment also runs the check for messages

Change-Id: Ia1be8f60265d9dab2639a05912b4b7c51f1d4033
'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2015-12-23 12:24:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e9a1b5c4cf585069702361e6aa309c9b2e60afe7', 'message': 'Enhances tox to not rely on run_tests

Several changes:
 - Dont rely on run_tests.sh and run the commands directly
 - Move the coverage options to the setup.cfg
 - Set py27 envs under the same umbrella
 - Split horizon and openstack_dashboard tests into 2
different envs
 - Remove usedevelop from most envs as its not needed
 - Set basepython to 27 on the default env
 - Allow adding posargs to py34 env
 - Add the karma tests as a new env
 - Add runserver as a new env
 - Move pep8 to be the first tests so we fail fast
 - Provide an env to tests against system packages, useful
for package builders that DONT want to test against pip
install but their local packages installation.
 - Allow to pass TOX_EXTRA_DEPS to the system_packages
tests in case some extra pip packages are needed
 - Add a manage env to pass commands to manage.py
 - Add an environment to createmessages
 - Add an environment to check only if we can create
messages
 - pep8 environment also runs the check for messages
 - All python commands use {envpython} so no escape
from the venv is possible
 - Uses {toxinidir} for a clear indication of where
the files to be executed are
 - Moves all keywords for pybabel to the setup.cfg
 - Removes not needed whitelist_external for all envs
and uses only git for one specific env

Change-Id: Ia1be8f60265d9dab2639a05912b4b7c51f1d4033

for package builders that DONT want to test against pip
install but their local packages installation.
 - Allow to pass TOX_EXTRA_DEPS to the system_packages
tests in case some extra pip packages are needed
 - Add a manage env to pass commands to manage.py
 - Add an environment to createmessages
 - Add an environment to check only if we can create
messages
 - pep8 environment also runs the check for messages
 - All python commands use {envpython} so no escape
from the venv is possible
 - Uses {toxinidir} for a clear indication of where
the files to be executed are
 - Moves all keywords for pybabel to the setup.cfg
 - Removes not needed whitelist_external for all envs
and uses only git for one specific env

Change-Id: Ia1be8f60265d9dab2639a05912b4b7c51f1d4033
Implements: blueprint enhance-tox
