commit_message:
Documentation and other improvements for registry

This patch improves the documentation of the
angular type registry.

It also removes use of "this" throughout the code
to reduce ambiguity, and moves the initAction method
to a more sensible place. The format() method is
no longer used (hz-cell formatting is used instead).

Finally it also adds an error log if the load function
isn't provided, otherwise developers could potentially
be chasing their tails by mis-configuring that feature.

Change-Id: I1b80971a4b19f26455dfc568de6bbb36b1245ef3
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/54/324154/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * * The type registry collects up implementations of user interface components for * angular panels in Horizon. These are tied to types using the HEAT type names, for * example, 'OS::Glance::Image', so types encapsulate a single object retreieved from * a service API. Other types might include Nova servers or Swift objects. * * Each resource type is a singleton; to create or retrieve the type use: * * var resourceType = registryService.getResourceType('OS::Glance::Image'); * * You may optionally peform some basic (property-based) configuration of the * ResourceType at this point, which makes setting the "names" property clearer: * * var resourceType = registryService.getResourceType( * 'OS::Glance::Image', * { names: [gettext('Image'), gettext('Images')] } * ); * * Types may have a number of aspects associated with them: * * - a simplified name for the type (singular and plural) * - a mechanism for retrieving objects of the type by id and listing objects * - actions that may be performed on individual or batches of objects and * globally (independent of any objects existing) * - details view(s) for individual objects (may tabbed multiple views) * - information about properties, including: * - labels used in places like table headers or forms * - formatting mechanisms for property values * * Types should be defined at the Angular module level, using the .run() function. * This allows actions to be configured (and extended) by any module. * * Apart from getResourceType, there are a number of other methods on the * service: * * initActions(type, scope) -- run from a controller that will be using * a ResourceType to invoke actions' initScope (where defined). * TODO why is this not a method ResourceType?? * * getGlobalActions() -- retrieves all global actions * * setSlug(slug, typeName) and getTypeNameBySlug(slug) -- for mapping URL slugs * to type names * * setDefaultSummaryTemplateUrl, getDefaultSummaryTemplateUrl, * setDefaultDetailsTemplateUrl, getDefaultDetailsTemplateUrl * TODO these are not actually used anywhere, no idea why they exist?! * /* * @ngdoc TODO NO_IDEA * @name ResourceType * @description * * Actions should be attached to the type by appending them to the itemActions * or batchActions properties of the type. Those are arrays that are extensible * using the extensibleService API (so for example append optionally takes a * priority). The intention is that the actions lists may be directly passed * to the <actions> directive: * * <actions allowed="resourceType.itemActions" type="row" VERIFY THIS IS VAGUELY CORRECT> * * Actions should not perform complex actions in their construction, for * example API calls, because as injectables their constructor is run * during injection, meaning API calls would be executed as the module * is initialized. This would mean those calls would be executed on any * Angular context initialization, such as going to the login page. Actions * should instead place such code in their initScope() functions. * * As mentioned, actions are added through the extensibleService API, or * at the simplest, just: * * resourceType.itemActions * .append({ * id: 'actionService', * service: actionService, * template: { text: gettext('Action') } * }) * * Action objects are described in the <actions> directive docs. * * An overview of the ResourceType API: * * getName(count) -- returns a generic human-readable name for the type, handling * multiples (i.e. 'OS::Glance::Image' might return 'Image' or 'Images' for * plural). The type's "names" holds an array of the labels to be used here, * eg. ['Image', 'Images'] * * itemName(item) -- given an instance of a type (as returned by load()) this * will generate a human-readable name for that specific instance. The function * used to generate the name is set with setItemNameFunction(). * * label(property_name) -- returns a human-readable name for the type's specific * property. The label is derived from the property definition from setProperty(). * * format(property_name, value) -- returns a human-readable version of a property's * value. The configuration for formatting the value are taken from the property * definitions provided through setProperty(). * * load(id) -- loads an instance of a type for the id supplied. The actual * loading is performed by the function passed into setLoadFunction(). * */ // this resource type. // TODO I don't know what the following is trying to say: // The expectation is that the key is the 'code' // TODO where is list()?! .setProperty("disk_size", { * Provides the table columns for this type and generates a 'title' * property on if not already present, using the label provided for * the ResourceType's property of the same name.
deleted_lines: * This service provides a registry which allows for registration of * configurations for resource types. The purpose of these registrations * is to make it easy for modules to register a variety of common features * that are used both in display and behavior related to resource types. * Ideally the primary members of a resource type are decided on by * the community; however it is possible using a configuration to add * all kinds of members to the resource type. * Common elements in resource type configurations include things like * batch and item actions, which are associated with the resource type * via a key. The key follows the format: OS::Glance::Image. * The functions that are exposed both assist with registration and also * provide utilities relevant for their consumption. * This service uses the extensibility service to decorate the individual * containers for the actions, so they may be best manipulated via its * decorated methods. * The concept for use is to register actions with the resource types at * the Angular module level, using the .run() function. This allows * actions to be configured by any module. * Actions should not perform complex actions in their construction, for * example API calls, because as injectables their constructor is run * during injection, meaning API calls would be executed as the module * is initialized. This would mean those calls would be executed on any * Angular context initialization, such as going to the login page. Actions * should instead place such code in their initScope() functions. // this resource type. The expectation is that the key is the 'code' .setproperty("disk_size", { * This is a convenience function that provides the table column * information back, but places a 'title' member on if not already * present, using the label provided for the resourceType's member of * the same name. * This function is a way of making use of the pre-existing registration * of a human-readable for the given property, so we don't have to specify * it again in the column registration.

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-29 15:35:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/46a0e356839a459be86fe2aed7ad69357a8b097a', 'message': 'Adding hz-property/-list and filter/value retrieval from properties

This patch adds hz-property, which outputs the given object property as a label
and value in a dt/dd.  This uses hz-cell which ensures that all display rules
dictated within the property configuration are followed.

hz-property-list is a level higher than hz-property, which allows for supplying
multiple properties to be displayed, to reduce excess markup.  It is not to be
used at the exclusion of hz-property, but just as a way to make it easier to
build simple displays.

Change-Id: I62e3d9e4217aae428277bbef669ba704600f0b43
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry

commit_message:
Adding hz-resource-property/-list and filter/value retrieval

This patch adds hz-resource-property, which outputs the given object
property as a label and value in a dt/dd.  This uses hz-cell which
ensures that all display rules dictated within the property
configuration are followed.

hz-resource-property-list is a level higher than hz-resource-property,
which allows for supplying multiple properties to be displayed, to
reduce excess markup.  It is not to be used at the exclusion of
hz-resource-property, but just as a way to make it easier to build
simple displays.

Change-Id: I62e3d9e4217aae428277bbef669ba704600f0b43
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry

commit_message:
Image uses hz-property for its drawer information

The Image drawer should use the hz-property so it is kept in sync with all other
uses of the properties (in tables, etc.).

Gets rid of filters in favor of simple mappings or functions.

Moves several functions out of the module into a basic images-service so
it's easy to access/test functions.

Change-Id: I4d881744a398f9aa076830b576cb9f66335d8ba9
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry

commit_message:
Enable tox to run the subset test cases.

Now the tox.ini is hardcode that could only run all test cases
in horizon/ and openstack_dashboard/. Following usage does not work:
"tox -e py27 openstack_dashboard.test.tests.policy:PolicyTestCase"
This patch enable pass args to run subset test cases.

Remove envs py27{-horizon,-openstack_dashboard}, you could run
"tox -e py27 horizon/openstack_dashboard".

Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-tox
Change-Id: I21224d49a7a6e07d0184871b21268199def76db6

added_lines: whitelist_externals = bash bash -c 'project=`echo {posargs} | cut -d. -f1`; \ if [ -z "$project" ]; then \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test horizon --settings=horizon.test.settings {posargs}; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test openstack_dashboard --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests {posargs}; \ else \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test {posargs} --settings=$project.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests; \ fi'whitelist_externals = bash bash -c 'project=`echo {posargs} | cut -d. -f1`; \ if [ -z "$project" ]; then \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test horizon --settings=horizon.test.settings {posargs}; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test openstack_dashboard --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests {posargs}; \ else \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test {posargs} --settings=$project.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests; \ fi'
deleted_lines: {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test horizon --settings=horizon.test.settings {posargs} {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test openstack_dashboard --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests {posargs} {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test --settings=horizon.test.settings horizon.test.tests {posargs} {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings \ --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests \ openstack_dashboard {posargs}

subject: Choose a server group when booting a VM with NG launch instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 18:33:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f3254598b1b290c890f18cffc1766084c7524186', 'message': 'Choose a server group when booting a VM with NG launch instance

Allow users to choose a server group when booting a VM.  Adds
an optional workflow step to the launch instance workflow that
shows the available server groups and details about each group.
The ability to choose a server groups already exists for the
legacy launch instance workflow as a dropdown list, but having
it as a separate step in the angular workflow provides the added
capability of seeing group details.

commit_message:
Choose a server group when booting a VM with NG launch instance

Allow users to choose a server group when booting a VM.  Adds
an optional workflow step to the launch instance workflow that
shows the available server groups and details about each group.
The ability to choose a server groups already exists for the
legacy launch instance workflow as a dropdown list, but having
it as a separate step in the angular workflow provides the added
capability of seeing group details.

To test this patch, create a server group via the nova CLI. Example:
  nova server-group-create group1 affinity

And use the angular launch instance workflow to select a server
group. To validate the new instance was added to the server group,
use the nova CLI:
  nova server-group-get [ID of server group]

Change-Id: I651817850ef8a5afec047a9a481843a5eddbf5a9
Implements: blueprint nova-server-groups
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/58/336158/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ServerGroups(generic.View): """API for nova server groups. """ url_regex = r'nova/servergroups/$' @rest_utils.ajax() def get(self, request): """Get a list of server groups. The listing result is an object with property "items". """ result = api.nova.server_group_list(request) return {'items': [u.to_dict() for u in result]} @urls.register

[Django 1.10] Remove old style URLS

Remove old style URLs (again). These are deprecated in 1.9 and removed
in 1.10.

commit_message:
hz-dynamic-table: Column level permissions

hz-dynamic-table doesn't have any way to dynamically determine
whether or not to display a column.  For example,
in openstack dashboard, we may want to display a column
only in certain policies pass check, if certain settings
are enabled, or services are enabled. In addition, a generic
allowed function can just be set on the column config.

This patch adds this ability as a reusable service.
The reusable service will make it possible for horizon
to easily check common sets of permissions on a
variety of objects including the hz-dynamic-table columns
(in this patch).

Child patches demonstrate its use on the images table.

Change-Id: I9f92b69d86d830387a83c28ec5829fb3c43fc4a6
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>

commit_message:
[Django 1.10] Fix get_form uses kwargs

In Django 1.10, get_from() needs to use kwargs instead of
a normal param.

Change-Id: Ie551a7cb2ac11dc81bf7016c69123a5534e36d0a
Partially-Implements: blueprint dj110
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/31/344931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_form(self, form_class=None): if form_class is None: form_class = self.get_form_class()

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2017-01-04 05:39:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/c1eb7b3ce209463f460ec36f147581b215e61e2e', 'message': "Adding identity domains table

This patch adds the domain table to the identity domains panel
adn domain detail page.
Actions will be added in subsequent patches.


To test this patch, it needs to show domain panel and enable angular
feature for domain panel.

To show domain panel (after installing OpenStack with latest Devstack).
 - using backends except signed cookie as SESSION_ENGINE in local_settings.py.
   e.g memcached
----
# We recommend you use memcached for development; otherwise after every reload
# of the django development server, you will have to login again. To use
# memcached set CACHES to something like
CACHES = {
   'default': {
       'BACKEND': 'django.core.cache.backends.memcached.MemcachedCache',
       'LOCATION': '127.0.0.1:11211',
   }
}
SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.cache'
----

 - enable OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT in local_settings.py
----
# Set this to True if running on a multi-domain model. When this is enabled, it
# will require the user to enter the Domain name in addition to the username
# for login.
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT = True
----

After that, if admin user logged in, the user could see Domain panel and
could operate actions for domains like Create.

To test this patch, after above, set 'domains_panel': True in 'ANGULAR_FEATURES'.

Change-Id: Ib15e25a4cebe6de83f1c2f427490d5850d36b908
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

commit_message:
Adding identity domains table

This patch adds the domain table to the identity domains panel
adn domain detail page.
Actions will be added in subsequent patches.

To test this patch, it needs to show domain panel and enable angular
feature for domain panel.

To show domain panel (after installing OpenStack with latest Devstack).
 - using backends except signed cookie as SESSION_ENGINE in local_settings.py.
   e.g memcached
----
CACHES = {
   'default': {
       'BACKEND': 'django.core.cache.backends.memcached.MemcachedCache',
       'LOCATION': '127.0.0.1:11211',
   }
}
SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.cache'
----

 - enable OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT in local_settings.py
----
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT = True
----

After that, if admin user logged in, the user could see Domain panel and
could operate actions for domains like Create.

To test this patch, after above, set 'domains_panel': True in 'ANGULAR_FEATURES'.

Change-Id: Ib15e25a4cebe6de83f1c2f427490d5850d36b908
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

commit_message:
Add Angular keystone user details use registry

supports v3 domain details

To Test
 - set 'users_panel' to True in settings.py

Co-Authored-By: Cindy Lu <clu@us.ibm.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-users

Change-Id: I2f8826b2e115dbb6843782cbfcf04d9639f26f98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/94/336394/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /** * (c) Copyright 2016 99Cloud * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('user overview controller', function() { var ctrl; var keystone = { getNamespaces: angular.noop }; beforeEach(module('horizon.app.core.users')); beforeEach(module('horizon.framework.conf')); beforeEach(inject(function($controller, $q) { var deferred = $q.defer(); deferred.resolve({data: {properties: {'a': 'apple'}}}); spyOn(keystone, 'getNamespaces').and.returnValue(deferred.promise); ctrl = $controller('UserOverviewController', { '$scope': {context: {loadPromise: deferred.promise}} } ); })); it('sets ctrl.resourceType', function() { expect(ctrl.resourceType).toBeDefined(); }); it('sets ctrl.metadata', inject(function($timeout) { $timeout.flush(); expect(ctrl.user).toBeDefined(); })); }); })();

commit_message:
Adding identity ng-roles panel

This patch adds an angular roles table.

To be added in subsequent patches:
 - Actions
 - filterFacets
 - Integration to Searchlight

To test, v3 needs to be enabled in local_settings.py and
 set 'roles_panel' to True in settings.py

Change-Id: Ie0eb168774f15536c778917abeb293e79d3b34e8
Co-Authored-By: Allen <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: kenji-i <ken-ishii@sx.jp.nec.com>
Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Partially-implements: blueprint ng-roles

commit_message:
Specify POLICY_CHECK_FUNCTION as a string

We don't want code in our settings.py and local_settings.py, and in
particular we don't want to have to import Python objects from all over
to set them as setting values -- instead, we can specify those as import
path strings. This also solves problems with importing order and loops.

This change is backwards-compatible, in the sense that you can still
import the objects directly and set them as the setting values.

Partially-Implements: blueprint ini-based-configuration
Change-Id: I8a346e55bb98e4e22e0c14a614c45d493d20feb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/48/402448/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def check(actions, request, target=None): # Note(Itxaka): This is to prevent circular dependencies and apps not ready # If you do django imports in your settings, you are gonna have a bad time from openstack_auth import policy return policy.check(actions, request, target) POLICY_CHECK_FUNCTION = check

commit_message:
DataTable column level policy

Add the ability to filter DataTable's columns depending on policy.
Allow to easily display admin only columns.

Useful when some data are not available to regular users
in API responses. When the policy checks fail for a user,
the DataTable instance ignore the columns as if they were not defined.

Change-Id: I4bf41fb63550725fe2bbb03c51909d22ee202725
Implements: blueprint datatable-column-level-policy-checks
DocImpact Document how to filter DataTable columns thanks to policy_rules argument

deleted_lines: update_action=None, link_attrs=None, for key, _column in self._columns.items(): column = copy.copy(_column) column.table = self columns.append((key, column))

commit_message:
Migrate Create Container to schema form

Remove custom form controller and modal and migrate
to the new schema form implementation.

Also, as a bonus, we now check the validity of the
new container name as the user enters it into the
form, before submission.

Add some basic docs with pointers and a simple
example.

Change-Id: I156ded96340c65710ee0aa9182f859243347e16b
Partially-Fixes: 1616306

'}, {'number': 30, 'created': '2016-08-26 11:13:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/66989b1f92a6d6369acf5cf631debed1b68d0db6', 'message': "Wrap api calls with tracing decorators

Since Horizon is going to be the first (or, one of the first)
OpenStack component using the new MongoDB driver, it won't be able to
retrieve traces made by other components using MongoDB driver (which
it should use because Ceilometer driver was too slow) for a
while. This means that Horizon itself is responsible for tracing the
rendering of its pages down to the layer where the flow of control
leaves Horizon domain. So, a lot of api wrappers in
openstack_dashboard.api are augmented with tracing decorator to
achieve this goal.

DEPLOY NOTES:

MongoDB cluster needs to be installed on Devstack host (default
configuration), see
https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-ubuntu/#install-mongodb-community-edition
for instructions. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside
/etc/mongod.conf and invoke `sudo service mongod restart` for the
changes to have an effect.

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib36692f0e9e68ed7fa0cd47919ba6581c9c8ab57
"}, {'number': 31, 'created': '2016-08-26 12:20:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/80fcbd01ffdd43fcf87ba1c6c5c073edfbbed129', 'message': "Wrap api calls with tracing decorators

for instructions. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside
/etc/mongod.conf and invoke `sudo service mongod restart` for the
changes to have an effect.

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib36692f0e9e68ed7fa0cd47919ba6581c9c8ab57
"}, {'number': 38, 'created': '2016-08-31 13:18:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e33eca0b05f7179d7345f1dfd5829f39c94bb59b', 'message': "Wrap api calls with tracing decorators

Since Horizon is going to be the first (or, one of the first)
OpenStack component using the new MongoDB driver, it won't be able to
retrieve traces made by other components using MongoDB driver (which
it should use because Ceilometer driver was too slow) for a
while. This means that Horizon itself is responsible for tracing the
rendering of its pages down to the layer where the flow of control
leaves Horizon domain. So, a lot of api wrappers in
openstack_dashboard.api are augmented with tracing decorator to
achieve this goal.

DEPLOY NOTES:

MongoDB cluster needs to be installed on Devstack host (default
configuration), see
https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-ubuntu/#install-mongodb-community-edition
for instructions. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside
/etc/mongod.conf and invoke `sudo service mongod restart` for the
changes to have an effect.

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib36692f0e9e68ed7fa0cd47919ba6581c9c8ab57

commit_message:
Wrap api calls with tracing decorators

Since Horizon is going to be the first (or, one of the first)
OpenStack component using the new MongoDB driver, it won't be able to
retrieve traces made by other components using MongoDB driver (which
it should use because Ceilometer driver was too slow) for a
while. This means that Horizon itself is responsible for tracing the
rendering of its pages down to the layer where the flow of control
leaves Horizon domain. So, a lot of api wrappers in
openstack_dashboard.api are augmented with tracing decorator to
achieve this goal.

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib36692f0e9e68ed7fa0cd47919ba6581c9c8ab57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/75/339675/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from osprofiler import profiler@profiler.trace('api.keystone.domain_create', info=None, hide_args=False, allow_multiple_trace=True)@profiler.trace('api.keystone.domain_get', info=None, hide_args=False, allow_multiple_trace=True)@profiler.trace('api.keystone.domain_delete', info=None, hide_args=False, allow_multiple_trace=True)@profiler.trace('api.keystone.domain_list', info=None, Provide both pythonic Django part and the static assets (angular
directives and styles) for the new panel.

DEPLOY NOTES:

MongoDB cluster needs to be installed on Devstack host (default
configuration), see
https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-ubuntu/#install-mongodb-community-edition
for instructions. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside
/etc/mongod.conf and invoke `sudo service mongod restart` for the
changes to have an effect.

Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ice7b8b4b4decad2c45a9edef3f3c4cc2ff759de4

Provide both pythonic Django part and the static assets (angular
directives and styles) for the new panel.

DEPLOY NOTES:

To enable panel itself, copy
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_toggle_profiler.py.example
file from the previous commit to
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_toggle_profiler.py and
copy openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled/_9030_profiler.py to
openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/_9030_profiler.py

To support storing profiler data on server-side, MongoDB cluster needs
to be installed on Devstack host (default configuration), see
https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-ubuntu/#install-mongodb-community-edition
for instructions. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside
/etc/mongod.conf and invoke `sudo service mongod restart` for the
changes to have an effect.

Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ice7b8b4b4decad2c45a9edef3f3c4cc2ff759de4

commit_message:
Add the Profiler panel to the Developer dashboard

Provide both pythonic Django part and the static assets (angular
directives and styles) for the new panel.

DEPLOY NOTES:

To enable panel itself, copy
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_profiler_settings.py.example
file from the previous commit to
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_profiler_settings.py
and copy openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled/_9030_profiler.py
to openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/_9030_profiler.py

To support storing profiler data on server-side, MongoDB cluster needs
to be installed on Devstack host (default configuration), see
https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-ubuntu/#install-mongodb-community-edition
for instructions. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside
/etc/mongod.conf and invoke `sudo service mongod restart` for the
changes to have an effect.

Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ice7b8b4b4decad2c45a9edef3f3c4cc2ff759de4

commit_message:
Magic Search in Angular Users table

Add support for magic search

To test:
(1) Set 'user_panel' to True in settings.py
(2) Click on filter input box for facets

Co-Authored-By: Randy Bertram <rbertram@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Sahlin <asahlin@us.ibm.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint filtered-client-side-table
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

Change-Id: Iaf6a415b25226ee6b30c048747c8e26691a0cfa0

commit_message:
Update Angular Users Table use registry

This patch updates an angular users table.

To be added in subsequent patches:
 - Detail Table
 - Actions
 - filterFacets
 - Integration to Searchlight

To Test
 - change 'users_panel' to True in settings.py

Change-Id: I3c4cb39d80adc9aa207e56dc72a936f567f5b4d1
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-users

controller = $injector.get('$controller'); spyOn(toastService, 'add').and.callFake(fakeToast); spyOn(policyAPI, 'ifAllowed').and.callFake(fakePolicy); spyOn(keystoneAPI, 'getUsers').and.callFake(fakePromise); expect(keystoneAPI.getCurrentUserSession).toHaveBeenCalled(); }); it('should not invoke keystone apis if policy fails', function() { policy.allowed = false; createController(); expect(policyAPI.ifAllowed).toHaveBeenCalled(); commit_message:
Migrate Swift to use ResourceType

Move object table definitions (columns, filters), properties
and actions to the OS::Swift::Object resource type.

Register the Container and Account resource types, though they
are not implemented to the same degree as Object.

Follow-on patches will be required to implement further
ResourceType support as they will some significant refactoring
of the current code to support ResourceType requirements.

Change-Id: Idccd382da0dab29a2497182f7423b08653be53f4
Partially-Implements: blueprint swift-ui-functionality

commit_message:
Document exception handling

Many new contributors print the errors returned by the API
directly to the UI. However, this is dangerous because errors
can be very technical/ reveal sensitive data/ and are not
translatable. We need to document this for reference.

Change-Id: Ic0ad138b69995d842af0eeeeab73fa3ebec795c9
Implements: bp document-exception-propogation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/56/395256/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Error Handling -------------- Avoid propogating direct exception messages throw by the OpenStack APIs. It is a precaution against giving obscure or possibly sensitive data to a user. These error messages from the API are also not translatable. Until there is a standard error handling framework implemented by the services which presents clean and translated messages, Horizon catches all the exceptions thrown by the API and normalizes them.

'}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2016-04-08 15:53:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/003b92e95f57c8a1421ed839886ee8dc3dc6174b', 'message': "Provide the bones of profiler: api, models and middleware

Middleware is the backbone of the whole profiler facility. It adds an
encoded payload to each request that should be profiled with
osprofiler library. This library is embedded into other OpenStack
services where it tries to decode the message with a known set of keys
(so Horizon middleware should use one of these keys) and if
successful, sends a message to Ceilometer. Every message has its own
id, the base id (root message id) and parent id. Using these 3 ids a
tree of trace messages is assembled.

Actually, Horizon Django application uses 2 middleware classes:
ProfilerClientMIddleware and
ProfilerMiddleware. ProfilerClientMiddleware is used to enable Horizon
self-profiling (profiling from the UI): if a specific key is found in
cookies, then 2 standard osprofiler headers are added to a
request. These headers are processed by ProfilerMiddleware which
should always be the last middleware class in a Django config, since
it's defines `process_view` method which returns HttpResponse object
effectively terminating the middleware process_view chain. Assuming
that all API calls happen during rendering a view, Horizon sets a
tracepoint there which becomes a root node of the trace calls tree.

Modules api and models mostly contain the (temporary) logic of
interaction with trace data cache built on top of Django database
facility. The cache is used to avoid current osprofiler ceilometer
driver slowness, due to which retrieval a single tree of trace calls
takes 10+ seconds (unacceptable for UI). Once a new driver is
finished, the cache will be eliminated.

Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib896676e304f2984c011bd1b610c86d1f24d46b9
"}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2016-05-12 11:59:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a9ae252fc1fc3db5c84043636f0e31bdc37fb371', 'message': "Provide the bones of profiler: api, models and middleware

Change-Id: Ib896676e304f2984c011bd1b610c86d1f24d46b9

Change-Id: Ib896676e304f2984c011bd1b610c86d1f24d46b9
"}, {'number': 30, 'created': '2016-07-20 12:49:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f17f417b84e4dfc1cafced43ce566ae8c5c53c3c', 'message': "Provide the bones of profiler: api, models and middleware

Middleware is the backbone of the whole profiler facility. It adds an
encoded payload to each request that should be profiled with
osprofiler library. This library is embedded into other OpenStack
services where it tries to decode the message with a known set of keys
(so Horizon middleware should use one of these keys) and if
successful, sends a message to Ceilometer. Every message has its own
id, the base id (root message id) and parent id. Using these 3 ids a
tree of trace messages is assembled.

Actually, Horizon Django application uses 2 middleware classes:
ProfilerClientMIddleware and
ProfilerMiddleware. ProfilerClientMiddleware is used to enable Horizon
self-profiling (profiling from the UI): if a specific key is found in
cookies, then 2 standard osprofiler headers are added to a
request. These headers are processed by ProfilerMiddleware which
should always be the last middleware class in a Django config, since
it's defines `process_view` method which returns HttpResponse object
effectively terminating the middleware process_view chain. Assuming
that all API calls happen during rendering a view, Horizon sets a
tracepoint there which becomes a root node of the trace calls tree.

Modules api and models mostly contain the (temporary) logic of
interaction with trace data cache built on top of Django database
facility. The cache is used to avoid current osprofiler ceilometer
driver slowness, due to which retrieval a single tree of trace calls
takes 10+ seconds (unacceptable for UI). Once a new driver is
finished, the cache will be eliminated.

Depends-On: Ibc3c02ee1da5c977b7ddaa909ea7e8cdfb439773
Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib896676e304f2984c011bd1b610c86d1f24d46b9

"}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2016-07-27 14:11:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3736c4c04c376eb4fdcca5b3dc16b26f96972432', 'message': "Provide the bones of profiler: api, models and middleware

encoded payload to each request that should be profiled with
osprofiler library. This library is embedded into other OpenStack
services where it tries to decode the message with a known set of keys
(so Horizon middleware should use one of these keys) and if

Actually, Horizon Django application uses 2 middleware classes:

id, the base id (root message id) and parent id. Using these 3 ids a
tree of trace messages is assembled.

Actually, Horizon Django application uses 2 middleware classes:
ProfilerClientMIddleware and
ProfilerMiddleware. ProfilerClientMiddleware is used to enable Horizon
self-profiling (profiling from the UI): if a specific key is found in
cookies, then 2 standard osprofiler headers are added to a
request. These headers are processed by ProfilerMiddleware which
should always be the last middleware class in a Django config, since
it's defines `process_view` method which returns HttpResponse object
effectively terminating the middleware process_view chain. Assuming
that all API calls happen during rendering a view, Horizon sets a
tracepoint there which becomes a root node of the trace calls tree.

Modules api and models mostly contain the (temporary) logic of
interaction with trace data cache built on top of Django database
facility. The cache is used to avoid current osprofiler ceilometer
driver slowness, due to which retrieval a single tree of trace calls
takes 10+ seconds (unacceptable for UI). Once a new driver is
finished, the cache will be eliminated.

Depends-On: Ibc3c02ee1da5c977b7ddaa909ea7e8cdfb439773
Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib896676e304f2984c011bd1b610c86d1f24d46b9

request. These headers are processed by ProfilerMiddleware which
should always be the last middleware class in a Django config, since
it's defines `process_view` method which returns HttpResponse object
effectively terminating the middleware process_view chain. Assuming
that all API calls happen during rendering a view, Horizon sets a
tracepoint there which becomes a root node of the trace calls tree.

commit_message:
Provide the bones of profiler: api and middleware

Middleware is the backbone of the whole profiler facility. It adds an
encoded payload to each request that should be profiled with
osprofiler library. This library is embedded into other OpenStack
services where it tries to decode the message with a known set of keys
(so Horizon middleware should use one of these keys) and if
successful, sends a message to MongoDB (via osprofiler driver). Every
message has its own id, the base id (root message id) and parent
id. Using these 3 ids a tree of trace messages is assembled.

Actually, Horizon Django application uses 2 middleware classes:
ProfilerClientMIddleware and
ProfilerMiddleware. ProfilerClientMiddleware is used to enable Horizon
self-profiling (profiling from the UI): if a specific key is found in
cookies, then 2 standard osprofiler headers are added to a
request. These headers are processed by ProfilerMiddleware which
should always be the last middleware class in a Django config, since
it's defines `process_view` method which returns HttpResponse object
effectively terminating the middleware process_view chain. Assuming
that all API calls happen during rendering a view, Horizon sets a
tracepoint there which becomes a root node of the trace calls tree.

Implements-blueprint: openstack-profiler-at-developer-dashboard
Change-Id: Ib896676e304f2984c011bd1b610c86d1f24d46b9

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ import horizon class Profiler(horizon.Panel): name = _("OpenStack Profiler") slug = 'profiler'

commit_message:
Server-side filtering Orchestration

Included patch 12 changes
Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering
Co-authored-by: Revon Mathews <revon.mathews@intel.com>
Change-Id: I22c5c736f756b1f5640d2fc4d284ac45deaefc19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/59/347459/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filter_type = 'server' filter_choices = (('name', _('Stack Name'), True), ('id', _('Stack ID'), True), ('status', _('Status'), True))
deleted_lines: def filter(self, table, stacks, filter_string): """Naive case-insensitive search.""" query = filter_string.lower() return [stack for stack in stacks if query in stack.name.lower()]

commit_message:
Flavors panel can switch to Angular

This patch enables all of the features for the Flavors panel to use Angular but
disables it, so that it is easy to switch on/off.

Note that we add integration test switches since it can't read the Django
conf.

Note that I changed the common tests to allow for testing of api calls that
don't produce error toasts, because we needed better branch coverage, and
the deleteFlavor api wasn't fully branch-tested.

Change-Id: I92b1b57bd486e5eb87179cb8d44b7551e9de2e0f
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-flavors

run.$inject = [ 'horizon.framework.conf.resource-type-registry.service', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.nova', 'horizon.app.core.flavors.basePath', 'horizon.app.core.flavors.service', 'horizon.app.core.flavors.resourceType' ]; function run(registry, glance, basePath, flavorsService, flavorResourceType) { registry.getResourceType(flavorResourceType) .setNames(gettext('Flavor'), gettext('Flavors')) .setSummaryTemplateUrl(basePath + 'details/drawer.html') .setProperty('name', { label: gettext('Flavor Name') }) .setProperty('vcpus', { label: gettext('VCPUs') }) .setProperty('ram', { label: gettext('RAM') }) .setProperty('root_disk', { label: gettext('Root Disk') }) .setProperty('ephemeral_disk', { label: gettext('Ephemeral Disk') }) .setProperty('swap_disk', { label: gettext('Swap Disk') }) .setProperty('rx_tx', { label: gettext('RX/TX Factor') }) .setProperty('id', { label: gettext('ID') }) .setProperty('is_public', { label: gettext('Public') }) .setProperty('metadata', { label: gettext('Metadata') }) .setListFunction(flavorsService.listFunction) .tableColumns .append({ id: 'name', priority: 1, sortDefault: true }) .append({ id: 'vcpus', priority: 1 }) .append({ id: 'ram', priority: 1 }) .append({ id: 'root_disk', priority: 1 }) .append({ id: 'ephemeral_disk', priority: 2 }) .append({ id: 'swap_disk', priority: 2 }) .append({ id: 'rx_tx', priority: 2 }) .append({ id: 'id', priority: 2 }) .append({ id: 'is_public', priority: 2 }) .append({ id: 'metadata', priority: 2 }); registry.getResourceType(flavorResourceType).filterFacets ; } config.$inject = [ '$provide', '$windowProvider', '$routeProvider' ]; /** * @name config * @param {Object} $provide * @param {Object} $windowProvider * @param {Object} $routeProvider * @description Routes used by this module. * @returns {undefined} Returns nothing */ function config($provide, $windowProvider, $routeProvider) { var path = $windowProvider.$get().STATIC_URL + 'app/core/flavors/'; $provide.constant('horizon.app.core.flavors.basePath', path); $routeProvider.when('/admin/flavors/', { templateUrl: path + 'panel.html' }); } })();

commit_message:
add ploop type to the list of image backends

Ploop is a disk loopback block device, which is used by OpenVZ/Virtuozzo
containers, described here: https://openvz.org/Ploop
This type of backend is supported since Virtuozzo support was added in
Kilo release. Implemented as a part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pcs-support
then pcs was renamed to virtuozzo
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/rename-pcs-to-virtuozzo

Change-Id: Ica7852f8b5d45938b66ae7ef71b4713eb2dd2a3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/52/340552/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add deprecation message to run_tests.sh

We should finally get rid of run_tests and just move to tox. Adds a
deprecation warning to give this change more visibility.

Change-Id: I4cfd8f031e49ae302ceee18496cc68bcec42c821
Implements: blueprint enhance-tox
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/44/381844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "" echo "The run_tests script is deprecated and will be removed in the " echo "Queens Release Cycle (13.0), in favor of tox." echo ""

subject: Enable volumes metadata update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-08 14:10:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/48a866504b641f92486884325c46bd836e4e66d3', 'message': 'Enable volumes metadata update

Cinder currently expose an api to let the users update
the volumes metadata so horizon should expose
this functionality. At the same time Glance is exposing
a metadata dictionary in Juno, where users can register
the key/value pairs that describe their cloud deployment.
This patch uses the glance metadata api to expose the available
metadata and the nova api to update the aggregates metadata.

Change-Id: If721ac1c908df7651d630f6e7d36f2cc4d69f5da
Implements: blueprint glaance-metadata-flavorsability-to-add-metadata-to-cinder-volumes-and-snapshots
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-08 14:14:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a8f2e644714202334077b13da6934a8fadb773bf', 'message': 'Enable volumes metadata update

Cinder currently expose an api to let the users update
the volumes metadata so horizon should expose
this functionality. At the same time Glance is exposing
a metadata dictionary in Juno, where users can register
the key/value pairs that describe their cloud deployment.
This patch uses the glance metadata api to expose the available
metadata and the nova api to update the aggregates metadata.

'}, {'number': 23, 'created': '2015-03-09 19:26:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/612bafe84d1a1dc69cbee298708c6127b7cccff4', 'message': 'Enable volumes metadata update

Cinder currently expose an api to let the users update the volumes
metadata so horizon should expose this functionality.

The metadata is filtered to remove image metadata attributes. There is
work in progress (in Cinder) that will expose the ability to
write-through image metadata to underlying images where appropriate.
Allowing setting of image properties in this UI would be confusing.

Change-Id: If721ac1c908df7651d630f6e7d36f2cc4d69f5da
Implements: blueprint ability-to-add-metadata-to-cinder-volumes-and-snapshots
Co-Authored-By: Santiago Baldassin <santiago.b.baldassin@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Skowron <pawel.skowron@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Fic <bartosz.fic@intel.com>

Co-Authored-By: David Lyle <david.lyle@intel.com>

'}, {'number': 28, 'created': '2016-09-09 15:37:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8e14b678dc453d91b8979741802028422d0d0be5', 'message': '[WIP] Enable volumes metadata update

Cinder currently expose an api to let the users update the volumes
metadata so horizon should expose this functionality.

The metadata is filtered to remove image metadata attributes. There is
work in progress (in Cinder) that will expose the ability to
write-through image metadata to underlying images where appropriate.
Allowing setting of image properties in this UI would be confusing.

Change-Id: If721ac1c908df7651d630f6e7d36f2cc4d69f5da

commit_message:
Enable volumes metadata update

Cinder currently expose an api to let the users update the volumes
metadata so horizon should expose this functionality.

The metadata is filtered to remove image metadata attributes. There is
work in progress (in Cinder) that will expose the ability to
write-through image metadata to underlying images where appropriate.
Allowing setting of image properties in this UI would be confusing.

Change-Id: If721ac1c908df7651d630f6e7d36f2cc4d69f5da
Implements: blueprint ability-to-add-metadata-to-cinder-volumes-and-snapshots
Co-Authored-By: Santiago Baldassin <santiago.b.baldassin@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Skowron <pawel.skowron@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Fic <bartosz.fic@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Lyle <david.lyle@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Karikh <pkarikh@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/80/112880/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.volumes.extras \ import urls as extras_urls url(r'^create_type$', views.CreateVolumeTypeView.as_view(), name='create_type'), url(r'^(?P<volume_id>[^/]+)/$', views.DetailView.as_view(), name='detail'), url(r'^(?P<id>[^/]+)/edit_capabilities/$', views.EditCapabilitiesView.as_view(), name='edit_capabilities'), url(r'^(?P<type_id>[^/]+)/extras/', include(extras_urls, namespace='extras')),
deleted_lines: from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.volumes.volumes \ import urls as volumes_urls url(r'^\?tab=volumes_group_tabs__volumes_tab$', views.IndexView.as_view(), name='volumes_tab'), url(r'', include(volumes_urls, namespace='volumes')),

subject: Server-side filtering for Instances (Project/Admin)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 17:02:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/25e14fcf503e9ac7e0ae392e4606afec67c34f22', 'message': "More available filters in servers (Nova)

This patch adds several filtering options available
in Nova. New fields:

- UUID
- Availability Zone
- Key Name
- IPv4 Address
- vCPUs
- Changes-since.

We may want to aid end-users with the usage
of these filters by providing a set of hints.

This patch just adds what's already available in
nova controllers.

Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering
Change-Id: I3b07674fc1083607cae5d1db5a691827bde46d7c

This patch does two things:
- Adds more than 8 filter choices to Instances
- Proposes changes to the UI by using input-groups and dynamic
placeholders that indicates possible values for each option.

New Filters:
- UUID
- Flavor Name
- Image Name
- Availability Zone
- Key Name
- IPv4 Address
- IPv6
- vCPUs
- Changes-since.

Affected views: Project->Instances and Admin->Instances

Changes to UI (Proposal)

- Focus on input after user selects a filter option
- Changes to input width/height with sass variables.
- Replaced "filter" button with "magnifier" icon.
- Now using "Input Group component": http://pasteboard.co/8jQF7HIuG.png
- Dynamic placeholders that update as the user selects a new choice:
 http://pasteboard.co/8jOrgcnsV.png http://pasteboard.co/PA8yeYJp.png

  These placeholders are optional and defined in the FilterAction of
  each view.

Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering
Change-Id: I3b07674fc1083607cae5d1db5a691827bde46d7c

commit_message:
Server-side filtering for Instances (Project/Admin)

New Filters:
- UUID
- Flavor Name
- Image Name
- Availability Zone
- Key Name
- IPv4 Address
- IPv6
- vCPUs
- Changes-since.

Affected views: Project->Instances and Admin->Instances

Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering
Change-Id: I3b07674fc1083607cae5d1db5a691827bde46d7c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 09:13:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/5717b732d0c544304494fd24aaf7e35017d163cc', 'message': 'Fix compatibility issues with Django 1.10

Required modifying our URL pattern decorator to
be compatible with the slightly different callback
attribute mechanism in 1.10

Modified breadcrumb structures to always be 2-tuples
as tuple unpacking is now strictly enforced in 1.10

Also made the following things changed in Django 1.10.
- fixed the now-deprecated TEMPLATE_DEBUG.
- Caught up with Request context change
- SimpleTestCase.urls is removed in 1.10.
  ROOT_URLCONF needs to be used instead.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix compatibility issues with Django 1.10

Required modifying our URL pattern decorator to
be compatible with the slightly different callback
attribute mechanism in 1.10

Modified breadcrumb structures to always be 2-tuples
as tuple unpacking is now strictly enforced in 1.10

Also made the following things changed in Django 1.10.
- fixed the now-deprecated TEMPLATE_DEBUG.
- Caught up with Request context change
- SimpleTestCase.urls is removed in 1.10.
  ROOT_URLCONF needs to be used instead.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <motoki@da.jp.nec.com>
Change-Id: I59cbd8bff117813258539ed0724fe89a9f5b77ee
Implements: blueprint dj110
(cherry picked from commit 3488ab3d40f90e9d01598912f7ee398c823f4385)

commit_message:
Fix compatibility issues with Django 1.10

Required modifying our URL pattern decorator to
be compatible with the slightly different callback
attribute mechanism in 1.10

Modified breadcrumb structures to always be 2-tuples
as tuple unpacking is now strictly enforced in 1.10

Also made the following things changed in Django 1.10.
- fixed the now-deprecated TEMPLATE_DEBUG.
- Caught up with Request context change
- SimpleTestCase.urls is removed in 1.10.
  ROOT_URLCONF needs to be used instead.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <motoki@da.jp.nec.com>
Change-Id: I59cbd8bff117813258539ed0724fe89a9f5b77ee
Implements: blueprint dj110

commit_message:
Quota cleanup of dynamic methods

Removing the usage of calling dynamic methods within the
quotas code.  This makes it difficult to support and see
who is calling what code.

Change-Id: Ie2c6be3233dd2cff16eb2271e2ac3f4b04d6e2b5
Implements: blueprint make-quotas-great-again
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/49/372549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_quota_data(request, tenant_mode=True, disabled_quotas=None, if tenant_mode: quotasets.append(nova.tenant_quota_get(request, tenant_id)) else: quotasets.append(nova.default_quota_get(request, tenant_id)) if tenant_mode: quotasets.append(cinder.tenant_quota_get(request, tenant_id)) else: quotasets.append(cinder.default_quota_get(request, tenant_id)) tenant_mode=False, tenant_mode=True,
deleted_lines: def _get_quota_data(request, method_name, disabled_quotas=None, quotasets.append(getattr(nova, method_name)(request, tenant_id)) quotasets.append(getattr(cinder, method_name)(request, tenant_id)) "default_quota_get", "tenant_quota_get",

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 16:27:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/0bf5dc6a86f03d5b9d38353a5f16c772049cac2c', 'message': '[WIP] Support for Glance v2

This is extremely WIPy and not ready for consumption. Only a basic
read-only wrapper is implemented for now. V1 should still work as
usual, v2 should work as read-only. Metadata/properties stuff with v2
entirely tbd.

Remaining TODOs:
- Fix failing tests / panel registration issue
- Properly use the APIVersionManager
- Stop hardcoding versions in glance.py
- Create / Update [ without messing the properties ]
- Unit tests for v1 and v2, test_data for both versions
- *A LOT* of work with properties, custom properties
- Also: handle case when custom properties are disabled

Implements blueprint: horizon-glance-v2
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brad Pokorny <Brad_Pokorny@symantec.com>

v1 or v2 and removes the dependency on the Glance v1 endpoint.

restricts some Glance functions that aren't supported in v2.

Implements blueprint: horizon-glance-v2

commit_message:
Support for Glance v2

Implements wrappers necessary for Horizon to work with either Glance
v1 or v2 and removes the dependency on the Glance v1 endpoint.
Handles the differences between setting properties with v1 and v2 and
restricts some Glance functions that aren't supported in v2.

Implements blueprint: horizon-glance-v2
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brad Pokorny <Brad_Pokorny@symantec.com>
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Liuqing Jing <jing.liuqing@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: Icca91c53eabf18c3109b3931ed53f70eaaaa0e56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/39/320039/43 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BaseGlanceAPIResourceWrapper(base.APIResourceWrapper): def __getattribute__(self, attr): # Because Glance v2 treats custom properties as normal # attributes, we need to be more flexible than the resource # wrappers usually allow. In v1 they were defined under a # "properties" attribute. if VERSIONS.active >= 2 and attr == "properties": # TODO(jpichon): This returns every property, duplicating # the "base" ones. We may need to rethink the concept of # separate "custom" properties with the way v2 handles # properties. Either way this should get fixed/improved # once this patch is more complete. return self._apiresource try: return object.__getattribute__(self, attr) except AttributeError: return getattr(self._apiresource, attr) @property def name(self): return getattr(self._apiresource, 'name', None) @property def size(self): return getattr(self._apiresource, 'size', 0) @size.setter def size(self, value): self._apiresource.size = value @property def is_public(self): # Glance v2 no longer has a 'is_public' attribute, but uses a # 'visibility' attribute instead. return (getattr(self._apiresource, 'is_public', None) or getattr(self._apiresource, 'visibility', None) == "public") def __eq__(self, other_image): return self._apiresource == other_image._apiresource def __ne__(self, other_image): return not self.__eq__(other_image) class Image(BaseGlanceAPIResourceWrapper): # TODO(jpichon): Access the schema from the client and determine # the base properties dynamically instead. # https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/etc/schema-image.json # (I'm surprised not to see attrs like "size" or "owner" in there # so there may be more to this.) _attrs = ["kernel_id", "ramdisk_id", "instance_uuid", "architecture", "os_distro", "os_version", "container_format", "disk_format", "created_at", "owner", "size", "id", "status", "updated_at", "visibility"] # TODO(jpichon): Glance expects the version to be in the URL now, # consider how this affects the way we determine versions.def glanceclient(request, version=None): api_version = VERSIONS.get_active_version() # TODO(jpichon): Temporarily keep both till we update the API calls # to stop hardcoding a version in this file. Once that's done we # can get rid of the deprecated 'version' parameter. if version is None: return api_version['client'].Client(url, token=request.user.token.id, insecure=insecure, cacert=cacert) else: return glance_client.Client(version, url, token=request.user.token.id, insecure=insecure, cacert=cacert) # Note: Glance is adding more than just public and private in Kilo PUBLIC_TO_VISIBILITY_MAP = { None: None, True: 'public', False: 'private' } # TODO(TravT) filter behavior from v1 to v2 has changed. Determine what else # to do and improve code. Initially, this is placeholder code that handles # that the admin panel view passes in is_public = None causing no results to # be returned. def _normalize_is_public_filter(filters): if not filters: return if VERSIONS.active >= 2: if 'is_public' in filters: visibility = PUBLIC_TO_VISIBILITY_MAP[filters['is_public']] del filters['is_public'] if visibility is not None: filters['visibility'] = visibility else: if 'visibility' in filters: filters['is_public'] = ( getattr(filters, 'visibility', None) == "public") del filter['visibility'] def _normalize_list_input(filters, **kwargs): _normalize_is_public_filter(filters) if VERSIONS.active < 2: # Glance v1 client processes some keywords specifically. # Others, it just takes as a nested dict called filters. # This results in the following being passed into the glance client: # { # 'is_public': u'true', # 'sort_key': u'name', # 'sort_dir': u'asc', # 'filters': { # u'min_disk': u'0', # u'name': u'mysql', # 'properties': { # u'os_shutdown_timeout': u'1' # } # } # } v1_keywords = ['page_size', 'limit', 'sort_dir', 'sort_key', 'marker', 'is_public', 'return_req_id', 'paginate'] filters = {} properties = {} for key, value in iter(kwargs.items()): if key in v1_keywords: continue else: filters[key] = value del kwargs[key] if properties: filters['properties'] = properties if filters: kwargs['filters'] = filters return Image(image) reversed_order=False, **kwargs): _normalize_list_input(filters, **kwargs) # TODO(jpichon): Do it better wrapped_images = [] for image in images: wrapped_images.append(Image(image)) return wrapped_images, has_more_data, has_prev_data return Image(glanceclient(request).images.update(image_id, **kwargs)) return Image(image)
deleted_lines: def glanceclient(request, version='1'): return glance_client.Client(version, url, token=request.user.token.id, insecure=insecure, cacert=cacert) if not hasattr(image, 'name'): image.name = None return image def is_image_public(im): is_public_v1 = getattr(im, 'is_public', None) if is_public_v1 is not None: return is_public_v1 else: return im.visibility == 'public' reversed_order=False): return images, has_more_data, has_prev_data return glanceclient(request).images.update(image_id, **kwargs) return image

commit_message:
Server-side filtering for Identity

Implements server-side filtering in Identity->Projects

Projects (Only V3 supports server filtering)
Users (Only V3 supports server filtering)
Groups
Roles

This filtering method allows a user to filter by
several fields:
- Name
- UUID
- Enabled

Cannot implement filter by email ttps://review.openstack.org/#/c/110970/

Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Castellanos <luis.daniel.castellanos@intel.com>

Change-Id: I37d6afdef84593e2779d21bec0c2f55e2794ab78

commit_message:
Update admin filter first setting to a dict

Previously the ADMIN_FILTER_DATA_FIRST setting was a True/False
setting that was taking over all the admin views leaving
operators without the opportunity to set this setting to views
individually.

This patch changes the setting to a dict where it can be specified
which panels/views will implement this setting individually.

Implements blueprint: admin-views-filter-first

Change-Id: I50deab878f68c1cc519aa9b47feaa2c58bb8eacc

added_lines: --- prelude: - Most of Horizons XStatic packages were updated during this cycle. other: - XStatic-Jasmine updated from 2.1.2.0 to 2.4.1.1 - XStatic-Font-Awesome updated from 4.3.0.0 to 4.5.0.0 - XStatic-Angular updated from 1.3.7.0 to 1.3.18.1 - XStatic-Bootstrap-SCSS updated from 3.2.0.0 to 3.3.6.0 - XStatic-Bootswatch updated from 3.3.5.3 to 3.3.6.0 - XStatic-MDI updated from 1.1.70.1 to 1.4.57.0

subject: Final changes to Angular Images before making default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 14:14:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/82326662ea9f5a252637fe08c5073fbd8c7d12fc', 'message': 'Final changes to Angular Images before making default

This addresses the suggestions found by Rob:

- The 'Is Public' attribute is in the drawer now (even on large screen sizes)
and we can't sort by shared, public etc, as far as I can tell. I don't think
we specifically need the buttons like the previous design had, but it feels
like a regression to have no filtering or sorting on that field? Perhaps
someone with better glance knowledge could correct me.

- Create/Edit Image > Image Details tab needs help text. Create has some info,
but Edit has nothing really. Also, we can drop that "description" header in
the help text; it doesnt add any value. This would be a nice improvement over
the Python version for novice users, and shouldnt take long to enter - just
pull info from the API docs.

- Create Volume help text is also entirely blank. We should fill that out
with some useful instructions, IMO.

- Create Volume should default to the first Availability Zone if there is
only one, as it is a required field anyway.

- The Image Details page now longer lists the owner ID. I don't think this
is addressed by Travis' patch either.

  FIX: This is now under the 'Security' heading.

- Kernel ID and Ramdisk ID seem empty in angular image details, but populated
in the python equivalent.

  FIX: This was a regression that this patch fixes.

- Why are created/updated/ID separated into "Record Properties"? Is there
something in the API about this, or is it just a presentation construct?

  CHANGE: Moved into the general 'Image' header.  Added a filter so that these
  can be implemented as basic property registrations.

- I think 'Filename' in angular image details can be hidden if empty.

  CHANGE: Instead of hiding, we can show the standard '-' if no filename.

Change-Id: I4b770f9e61f9a8b1bd735d95c2ccc75bc21dd944
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Final changes to Angular Images before making default

This addresses the suggestions found by Rob and Travis:

- The Admin panel doesn't show *all* images, just those either in the current
  project or exposed as public (same as Project). (Travis)

  FIX: The Admin panel now supplies is_public: None as the Python code does,
  which allows all images to be shown.

- The 'Is Public' attribute is in the drawer now (even on large screen sizes)
and we can't sort by shared, public etc, as far as I can tell. I don't think
we specifically need the buttons like the previous design had, but it feels
like a regression to have no filtering or sorting on that field? Perhaps
someone with better glance knowledge could correct me.

  FIX: Added 'visibility' as a synthesized field and added as a facet, making
  sure to use the current project to correctly identify 'Shared with Project'.
  Did *not* add 'Is Public' as that is a vestigial concept.

- Create/Edit Image > Image Details tab needs help text. Create has some info,
but Edit has nothing really. Also, we can drop that "description" header in
the help text; it doesnt add any value. This would be a nice improvement over
the Python version for novice users, and shouldnt take long to enter - just
pull info from the API docs.

  NO CHANGE: Let's not block enablement on verbiage. I think we need a better
  consistency and I don't believe the last-minute is the best time to add this
  because it's very easy to create/find nits.

- Create Volume help text is also entirely blank. We should fill that out
with some useful instructions, IMO.

  FIX: Added basic help text.

- Create Volume should default to the first Availability Zone if there is
only one, as it is a required field anyway.

  FIX: I added logic for this, and also added in some test features so we don't
  lose coverage.

- The Image Details page now longer lists the owner ID. I don't think this
is addressed by Travis' patch either.

  FIX: This is now under the 'Security' heading.

- Kernel ID and Ramdisk ID seem empty in angular image details, but populated
in the python equivalent.

  FIX: This was a regression that this patch fixes.

- Why are created/updated/ID separated into "Record Properties"? Is there
something in the API about this, or is it just a presentation construct?

  CHANGE: Moved into the general 'Image' header.  Added a filter so that these
  can be implemented as basic property registrations.

- I think 'Filename' in angular image details can be hidden if empty.

  CHANGE: Instead of hiding, we can show the standard '-' if no filename.

Change-Id: I4b770f9e61f9a8b1bd735d95c2ccc75bc21dd944
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/01/356501/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .filter('simpleDate', simpleDateFilter) * @name simpleDate * @description * Evaluates given for display as a short date, returning '-' if empty. */ simpleDateFilter.$inject = ['$filter']; function simpleDateFilter($filter) { return function (input) { return $filter('noValue')($filter('date')(input, 'short')); }; } /** * @ngdoc filter

commit_message:
Supports extra properties in project and user

This change is to support extra properties in project and user.
To show an extra property in project/user table, you can customize.
The explanation of the method to add an extra property is added
by this patch.
In addition, when you do a create or update user, you can specify a
value of extra property by setting in local_settings.py

Change-Id: Ifee491f2a55d9207fe5da70136f749e1fc4bab82
Implements: blueprint support-extra-prop-for-project-and-user

commit_message:
Add HTML lists to preview page

Removed legacy style that was augmenting global UL lists.

Partially-Implements blueprint bootstrap-theme-preview

Change-Id: I805d2e4f9d0ae9703e725f9be9090f8fea5e948c

commit_message:
Server-side filtering networks

Implements server-side filtering networks in:
  - Admin->System->Networks
  - Project->Network->Networks

Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ie05f58a77b62b12dbf087395fbaf4ff0dc1f8562
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/84/329184/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: search_opts = self.get_filters() self.request, tenant_id, include_external=True, **search_opts) def get_filters(self): filters = {} filter_field = self.table.get_filter_field() filter_action = self.table._meta._filter_action if filter_action.is_api_filter(filter_field): filter_string = self.table.get_filter_string().strip() if filter_field and filter_string: if filter_string == 'True': filter_string = True elif filter_string == 'False': filter_string = False filters[filter_field] = filter_string return filters

commit_message:
Implement file update (edit) in Swift UI

The ability to update (edit contents of) an object was
never present in the previous Swift UI. It was
explicitly blocked due to code in the swift_upload_object()
function, which has been removed in this patch. To
replace that "upload would replace existing contents"
check, this patch implements a client-side check to warn
the user if the upload would do so.

Partially-Implements: blueprint swift-ui-functionality
Change-Id: I9fb57dda59322907f0661372f9ee223551ff8a6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/64/332664/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: it('returns a relevant error message when uploadObject returns a 409 error', function test() { var promise = {error: angular.noop}; spyOn(apiService, 'post').and.returnValue(promise); spyOn(promise, 'error'); service.uploadObject('spam', 'ham'); spyOn(toastService, 'add'); var innerFunc = promise.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]; // In the case of 409 var message = 'A object with the name "ham" already exists.'; innerFunc(message, 409); expect(toastService.add).toHaveBeenCalledWith('error', message); });

2.allocate floating IP to specific tenant
3.release/delete floating IP
4.update floating IP association(change port)

Partially implements blueprint: manage-ips

commit_message:
Add floating IP panel to admin dashboard

Now system administrators have CRUD abilities to manage floating IP.
1.floating IP list table
2.allocate floating IP to specific tenant
3.release/delete floating IP

Partially implements blueprint: manage-ips

commit_message:
Update the xstatic release process

We no longer use tagging to trigger release, but rather
use the openstack release management project.

Change-Id: Idad9d8bd7297db2afff4ead4a029ebf001601371
Implements: blueprint xstatic-release-process
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/07/344007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3. Once the review is approved and the change merged, `request a release`_ by updating or creating the appropriate file for the xstatic package in the `releases repository`_ under `deliverables/_independent`. That will cause it to be somewhat automatically packaged and released to PyPi... _`request a release`: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/README.rst .. _`releases repository`: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases
deleted_lines: 3. Once the review is approved and the change merged, `tag your release`_. That will cause it to be automatically packaged and released to PyPi... _`Tag your release`: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#tagging-a-release

commit_message:
Use argparse instead of optparse

Use of optparse module is deprecated [1] in Django 1.8 and 1.9 versions and
its support has been removed in currently developed version 1.10 [2]

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/howto/custom-management-commands/#django.core.management.BaseCommand.option_list
[2] https://github.com/django/django/commit/6a70cb53971a19f2d9e71d5ee24bfb0e844b4d9d#diff-dfc45ab8548a0777543d12d6e77c9173

Change-Id: I0c7622fce0d5fabce45366d002b5e72e4c170344

added_lines: def add_arguments(self, parser): parser.add_argument( "-a", "--apache", default=False, action="store_true", dest="apache", help="generate an apache vhost configuration" ) parser.add_argument( "--cacert", dest="cacert", help=("Use with the --apache and --ssl option to define the path" " to the SSLCACertificateFile"), metavar="CACERT" ) parser.add_argument( "-f", "--force", default=False, action="store_true", dest="force", help="force overwriting of an existing %s file" % context['WSGI_FILE'] ) parser.add_argument( "-H", "--hostname", dest="hostname", help=("Use with the --apache option to define the server's" " hostname (default : %s)") % context['VHOSTNAME'], metavar="HOSTNAME" ) parser.add_argument( "--logdir", dest="logdir", help=("Use with the --apache option to define the path to " "the apache log directory(default : %s)" % context['LOGDIR']), metavar="CACERT" ) parser.add_argument( "-m", "--mail", dest="mail", help=("Use with the --apache option to define the web site" " administrator's email (default : %s)") % context['ADMIN'], metavar="MAIL" ) parser.add_argument( "-n", "--namedhost", default=False, action="store_true", dest="namedhost", help=("Use with the --apache option. The apache vhost " "configuration will work only when accessed with " "the proper hostname (see --hostname).") ) parser.add_argument( "-p", "--project", dest="project", help=("Use with the --apache option to define the project " "name (default : %s)") % context['PROJECT_NAME'], metavar="PROJECT" ) parser.add_argument( "-s", "--ssl", default=False, action="store_true", dest="ssl", help=("Use with the --apache option. The apache vhost " "configuration will use an SSL configuration") ) parser.add_argument( "--sslcert", dest="sslcert", help=("Use with the --apache and --ssl option to define " "the path to the SSLCertificateFile (default : %s)" ) % context['SSLCERT'], metavar="SSLCERT" ) parser.add_argument( "--sslkey", dest="sslkey", help=("Use with the --apache and --ssl option to define " "the path to the SSLCertificateKeyFile " "(default : %s)") % context['SSLKEY'], metavar="SSLKEY" ) parser.add_argument( "--apache-version", dest="apache_version", type="float", help=("Use with the --apache option to define the apache " "major (as a floating point number) version " "(default : %s)." % context['APACHE2_VERSION']), metavar="APACHE_VERSION" ) parser.add_argument( "-w", "--wsgi", default=False, action="store_true", dest="wsgi", help="generate the horizon.wsgi file" )

subject: Restrict user private network cidr input
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-20 08:00:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/393d75901d57b0e2af2a2fc5b612ef148e9adb67', 'message': 'Restrict user private network cidr input

Add a RESTRICT_PRIVATE_NET_CIDR to decide whether to
restrict user private network cidr input.
If the user private network has the same cidr with public network.
It is unable to set router gateway when the router is already has
interface of the private network which has the same ip cidr with
public network.
Or the router already has the private network interface it will be
unable to set gateway.

Implements blueprint: restrict-private-network-input
Change-Id: I6b2ee58447d517c1c40344b8f4dd95968638da5b

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-06 10:26:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/89508aaf41b638f756a06a6cf758e4455a7289c1', 'message': "Restrict user private network cidr input

If the user private network has the same cidr with public network.
It is unable to set router gateway when the router is already has
interface of the private network which has the same ip cidr with
public network.
Or the router already has the private network interface it will be
unable to set gateway.

This blueprint add setting 'ALLOWED_PRIVATE_NET_CIDR' to decide
whether to restrict user private network cidr input. And admin
dashboard network was not restricted.

Exemple:
ALLOWED_PRIVATE_NET_CIDR = {'v4': ['192.168.0.0/16', '10.0.0.0/8'],
                            'v6': ['fc00::/7',]}

By default, leave the 'v4' and 'v6' with empty list,
then user subnet cidr input will not be restricted.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint: restrict-private-network-input
Change-Id: I6b2ee58447d517c1c40344b8f4dd95968638da5b

whether to restrict user private network cidr input. And admin
dashboard network was not restricted.

Exemple:

commit_message:
Restrict user private network cidr input

If the user's private network has the same CIDR as the public
network, there will be an error.  The router is unable to set
the gateway properly when the private and public CIDR overlap.

This patch add setting 'ALLOWED_PRIVATE_SUBNET_CIDR' to decide
whether to restrict user private network cidr input. And admin
dashboard network panel was not restricted.

Example:
ALLOWED_PRIVATE_SUBNET_CIDR = {'ipv4': ['192.168.0.0/16',
                                        '10.0.0.0/8'],
                               'ipv6': ['fc00::/7',]}

By default, leave the 'ipv4' and 'ipv6' with empty lists,
then user subnet cidr input will not be restricted.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint: restrict-private-network-input
Change-Id: I6b2ee58447d517c1c40344b8f4dd95968638da5b

commit_message:
Server-side filtering routers

Implements server-side filtering for routers:
  - Admin->System->Routers
  - Project->Network->Routers

Implements blueprint: server-side-filtering

Depends-On: Idaee431ed15de81e5ea049948b55d1526e2024ac
